instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType.KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType


module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationDescription

--   with the Apache Kafka cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKafkaClusterClientAuthenticationDescription</a>
--   smart constructor.
data KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationDescription
KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationDescription' :: Maybe KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType -> KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationDescription

-- | The type of client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka
--   cluster. Value NONE means that no client authentication is used.

--   Kafka cluster. Value NONE means that no client authentication is used.

module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.Plugin

-- | A plugin is an AWS resource that contains the code that defines your
--   connector logic.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPlugin</a> smart constructor.
data Plugin
Plugin' :: CustomPlugin -> Plugin

-- | Details about a custom plugin.
[$sel:customPlugin:Plugin'] :: Plugin -> CustomPlugin

-- | Create a value of <a>Plugin</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customPlugin:Plugin'</a>, <a>plugin_customPlugin</a> - Details
--   about a custom plugin.
newPlugin :: CustomPlugin -> Plugin

-- | Details about a custom plugin.
plugin_customPlugin :: Lens' Plugin CustomPlugin
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.Plugin.Plugin
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.Plugin.Plugin
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.Plugin.Plugin
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.Plugin.Plugin
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.Plugin.Plugin
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.Plugin.Plugin
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.Plugin.Plugin

module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ProvisionedCapacity

-- | Details about a connector's provisioned capacity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProvisionedCapacity</a> smart constructor.
data ProvisionedCapacity
ProvisionedCapacity' :: Natural -> Natural -> ProvisionedCapacity

-- | The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector
--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
[$sel:mcuCount:ProvisionedCapacity'] :: ProvisionedCapacity -> Natural

-- | The number of workers that are allocated to the connector.
[$sel:workerCount:ProvisionedCapacity'] :: ProvisionedCapacity -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ProvisionedCapacity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mcuCount:ProvisionedCapacity'</a>,
--   <a>provisionedCapacity_mcuCount</a> - The number of microcontroller
--   units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are
--   1,2,4,8.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workerCount:ProvisionedCapacity'</a>,
--   <a>provisionedCapacity_workerCount</a> - The number of workers that
--   are allocated to the connector.
newProvisionedCapacity :: Natural -> Natural -> ProvisionedCapacity

-- | The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector
--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
provisionedCapacity_mcuCount :: Lens' ProvisionedCapacity Natural

-- | The number of workers that are allocated to the connector.
provisionedCapacity_workerCount :: Lens' ProvisionedCapacity Natural
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ProvisionedCapacity.ProvisionedCapacity
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ProvisionedCapacity.ProvisionedCapacity
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ProvisionedCapacity.ProvisionedCapacity
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ProvisionedCapacity.ProvisionedCapacity
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ProvisionedCapacity.ProvisionedCapacity
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ProvisionedCapacity.ProvisionedCapacity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ProvisionedCapacity.ProvisionedCapacity


module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ProvisionedCapacityDescription

-- | The description of a connector's provisioned capacity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProvisionedCapacityDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ProvisionedCapacityDescription
ProvisionedCapacityDescription' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> ProvisionedCapacityDescription

--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.

--   microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The
--   valid values are 1,2,4,8.

--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.

module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.S3Location

-- | The location of an object in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3Location</a> smart constructor.
data S3Location
S3Location' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> S3Location

-- | The version of an object in an S3 bucket.
[$sel:objectVersion:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an S3 bucket.
[$sel:bucketArn:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> Text

-- | The file key for an object in an S3 bucket.
[$sel:fileKey:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>S3Location</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectVersion:S3Location'</a>, <a>s3Location_objectVersion</a>
--   - The version of an object in an S3 bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketArn:S3Location'</a>, <a>s3Location_bucketArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an S3 bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileKey:S3Location'</a>, <a>s3Location_fileKey</a> - The file
--   key for an object in an S3 bucket.
newS3Location :: Text -> Text -> S3Location

-- | The version of an object in an S3 bucket.
s3Location_objectVersion :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an S3 bucket.
s3Location_bucketArn :: Lens' S3Location Text

-- | The file key for an object in an S3 bucket.
s3Location_fileKey :: Lens' S3Location Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.S3Location.S3Location
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.S3Location.S3Location
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.S3Location.S3Location
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.S3Location.S3Location
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.S3Location.S3Location
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.S3Location.S3Location
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.S3Location.S3Location


module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CustomPluginLocation

-- | Information about the location of a custom plugin.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomPluginLocation</a> smart constructor.
data CustomPluginLocation
CustomPluginLocation' :: S3Location -> CustomPluginLocation

-- | The S3 bucket Amazon Resource Name (ARN), file key, and object version
--   of the plugin file stored in Amazon S3.
[$sel:s3Location:CustomPluginLocation'] :: CustomPluginLocation -> S3Location

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomPluginLocation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Location:CustomPluginLocation'</a>,
--   <a>customPluginLocation_s3Location</a> - The S3 bucket Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN), file key, and object version of the plugin file stored in
--   Amazon S3.
newCustomPluginLocation :: S3Location -> CustomPluginLocation

-- | The S3 bucket Amazon Resource Name (ARN), file key, and object version
--   of the plugin file stored in Amazon S3.
customPluginLocation_s3Location :: Lens' CustomPluginLocation S3Location
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CustomPluginLocation.CustomPluginLocation
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CustomPluginLocation.CustomPluginLocation
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CustomPluginLocation.CustomPluginLocation
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CustomPluginLocation.CustomPluginLocation

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CustomPluginLocation.CustomPluginLocation

data S3LocationDescription
S3LocationDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> S3LocationDescription

[$sel:objectVersion:S3LocationDescription'] :: S3LocationDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an S3 bucket.
[$sel:bucketArn:S3LocationDescription'] :: S3LocationDescription -> Maybe Text

--   an S3 bucket.

-- | Details about the revision of a custom plugin.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomPluginRevisionSummary</a> smart constructor.
data CustomPluginRevisionSummary
CustomPluginRevisionSummary' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe CustomPluginLocationDescription -> Maybe CustomPluginFileDescription -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CustomPluginContentType -> CustomPluginRevisionSummary

-- | The time that the custom plugin was created.
[$sel:creationTime:CustomPluginRevisionSummary'] :: CustomPluginRevisionSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Information about the location of the custom plugin.
[$sel:location:CustomPluginRevisionSummary'] :: CustomPluginRevisionSummary -> Maybe CustomPluginLocationDescription

[$sel:fileDescription:CustomPluginRevisionSummary'] :: CustomPluginRevisionSummary -> Maybe CustomPluginFileDescription

[$sel:revision:CustomPluginRevisionSummary'] :: CustomPluginRevisionSummary -> Maybe Integer

[$sel:description:CustomPluginRevisionSummary'] :: CustomPluginRevisionSummary -> Maybe Text

[$sel:contentType:CustomPluginRevisionSummary'] :: CustomPluginRevisionSummary -> Maybe CustomPluginContentType

--   location of the custom plugin.

--   custom plugin file.

--   <a>$sel:revision:CustomPluginRevisionSummary'</a>,

--   custom plugin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CustomPluginRevisionSummary'</a>,

--   the custom plugin.

--   <a>customPluginRevisionSummary_contentType</a> - The format of the
--   plugin file.

module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CustomPluginSummary

-- | A summary of the custom plugin.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomPluginSummary</a> smart constructor.
data CustomPluginSummary
CustomPluginSummary' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe CustomPluginRevisionSummary -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CustomPluginState -> Maybe Text -> CustomPluginSummary

-- | The time that the custom plugin was created.
[$sel:creationTime:CustomPluginSummary'] :: CustomPluginSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The latest revision of the custom plugin.
[$sel:latestRevision:CustomPluginSummary'] :: CustomPluginSummary -> Maybe CustomPluginRevisionSummary

-- | The name of the custom plugin.
[$sel:name:CustomPluginSummary'] :: CustomPluginSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom plugin.
[$sel:customPluginArn:CustomPluginSummary'] :: CustomPluginSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The state of the custom plugin.
[$sel:customPluginState:CustomPluginSummary'] :: CustomPluginSummary -> Maybe CustomPluginState

-- | A description of the custom plugin.
[$sel:description:CustomPluginSummary'] :: CustomPluginSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomPluginSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:CustomPluginSummary'</a>,
--   <a>customPluginSummary_creationTime</a> - The time that the custom
--   plugin was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:latestRevision:CustomPluginSummary'</a>,
--   <a>customPluginSummary_latestRevision</a> - The latest revision of the
--   custom plugin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CustomPluginSummary'</a>, <a>customPluginSummary_name</a>
--   - The name of the custom plugin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customPluginArn:CustomPluginSummary'</a>,
--   <a>customPluginSummary_customPluginArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the custom plugin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customPluginState:CustomPluginSummary'</a>,
--   <a>customPluginSummary_customPluginState</a> - The state of the custom
--   plugin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CustomPluginSummary'</a>,
--   <a>customPluginSummary_description</a> - A description of the custom
--   plugin.
newCustomPluginSummary :: CustomPluginSummary

-- | The time that the custom plugin was created.
customPluginSummary_creationTime :: Lens' CustomPluginSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The latest revision of the custom plugin.
customPluginSummary_latestRevision :: Lens' CustomPluginSummary (Maybe CustomPluginRevisionSummary)

-- | The name of the custom plugin.
customPluginSummary_name :: Lens' CustomPluginSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom plugin.
customPluginSummary_customPluginArn :: Lens' CustomPluginSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The state of the custom plugin.
customPluginSummary_customPluginState :: Lens' CustomPluginSummary (Maybe CustomPluginState)

-- | A description of the custom plugin.
customPluginSummary_description :: Lens' CustomPluginSummary (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CustomPluginSummary.CustomPluginSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CustomPluginSummary.CustomPluginSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CustomPluginSummary.CustomPluginSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CustomPluginSummary.CustomPluginSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CustomPluginSummary.CustomPluginSummary

module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.S3LogDelivery

-- | Details about delivering logs to Amazon S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3LogDelivery</a> smart constructor.
data S3LogDelivery
S3LogDelivery' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Bool -> S3LogDelivery

-- | The S3 prefix that is the destination for log delivery.
[$sel:prefix:S3LogDelivery'] :: S3LogDelivery -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the S3 bucket that is the destination for log delivery.
[$sel:bucket:S3LogDelivery'] :: S3LogDelivery -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether connector logs get sent to the specified Amazon S3
--   destination.
[$sel:enabled:S3LogDelivery'] :: S3LogDelivery -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>S3LogDelivery</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   S3 prefix that is the destination for log delivery.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:S3LogDelivery'</a>, <a>s3LogDelivery_bucket</a> - The
--   name of the S3 bucket that is the destination for log delivery.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:S3LogDelivery'</a>, <a>s3LogDelivery_enabled</a> -
--   Specifies whether connector logs get sent to the specified Amazon S3
--   destination.
newS3LogDelivery :: Bool -> S3LogDelivery

-- | The name of the S3 bucket that is the destination for log delivery.

--   destination.

--   utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector scale in

--   connector scale in to be triggered.

module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScaling

-- | Specifies how the connector scales.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScaling</a> smart constructor.
data AutoScaling
AutoScaling' :: Maybe ScaleInPolicy -> Maybe ScaleOutPolicy -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> AutoScaling

-- | The sacle-in policy for the connector.
[$sel:scaleInPolicy:AutoScaling'] :: AutoScaling -> Maybe ScaleInPolicy

-- | The sacle-out policy for the connector.
[$sel:scaleOutPolicy:AutoScaling'] :: AutoScaling -> Maybe ScaleOutPolicy

-- | The maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
[$sel:maxWorkerCount:AutoScaling'] :: AutoScaling -> Natural

-- | The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector
--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
[$sel:mcuCount:AutoScaling'] :: AutoScaling -> Natural

-- | The minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
[$sel:minWorkerCount:AutoScaling'] :: AutoScaling -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScaling</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleInPolicy:AutoScaling'</a>,
--   <a>autoScaling_scaleInPolicy</a> - The sacle-in policy for the
--   connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleOutPolicy:AutoScaling'</a>,
--   <a>autoScaling_scaleOutPolicy</a> - The sacle-out policy for the
--   connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxWorkerCount:AutoScaling'</a>,
--   <a>autoScaling_maxWorkerCount</a> - The maximum number of workers
--   allocated to the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mcuCount:AutoScaling'</a>, <a>autoScaling_mcuCount</a> - The
--   number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector
--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minWorkerCount:AutoScaling'</a>,
--   <a>autoScaling_minWorkerCount</a> - The minimum number of workers
--   allocated to the connector.
newAutoScaling :: Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> AutoScaling

-- | The sacle-in policy for the connector.
autoScaling_scaleInPolicy :: Lens' AutoScaling (Maybe ScaleInPolicy)

-- | The sacle-out policy for the connector.
autoScaling_scaleOutPolicy :: Lens' AutoScaling (Maybe ScaleOutPolicy)

-- | The maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
autoScaling_maxWorkerCount :: Lens' AutoScaling Natural

-- | The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector
--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
autoScaling_mcuCount :: Lens' AutoScaling Natural

-- | The minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
autoScaling_minWorkerCount :: Lens' AutoScaling Natural
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScaling.AutoScaling
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScaling.AutoScaling
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScaling.AutoScaling
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScaling.AutoScaling
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScaling.AutoScaling
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScaling.AutoScaling
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScaling.AutoScaling


module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.Capacity

-- | Information about the capacity of the connector, whether it is auto
--   scaled or provisioned.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCapacity</a> smart constructor.
data Capacity
Capacity' :: Maybe AutoScaling -> Maybe ProvisionedCapacity -> Capacity

-- | Information about the auto scaling parameters for the connector.
[$sel:autoScaling:Capacity'] :: Capacity -> Maybe AutoScaling

-- | Details about a fixed capacity allocated to a connector.
[$sel:provisionedCapacity:Capacity'] :: Capacity -> Maybe ProvisionedCapacity

-- | Create a value of <a>Capacity</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScaling:Capacity'</a>, <a>capacity_autoScaling</a> -
--   Information about the auto scaling parameters for the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedCapacity:Capacity'</a>,
--   <a>capacity_provisionedCapacity</a> - Details about a fixed capacity
--   allocated to a connector.
newCapacity :: Capacity

-- | Information about the auto scaling parameters for the connector.
capacity_autoScaling :: Lens' Capacity (Maybe AutoScaling)

-- | Details about a fixed capacity allocated to a connector.
capacity_provisionedCapacity :: Lens' Capacity (Maybe ProvisionedCapacity)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.Capacity.Capacity
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.Capacity.Capacity
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.Capacity.Capacity
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.Capacity.Capacity
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.Capacity.Capacity
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.Capacity.Capacity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.Capacity.Capacity


module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ScaleOutPolicyDescription

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScaleOutPolicyDescription</a> smart constructor.
data ScaleOutPolicyDescription
ScaleOutPolicyDescription' :: Maybe Int -> ScaleOutPolicyDescription

-- | The CPU utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector
--   scale out to be triggered.
[$sel:cpuUtilizationPercentage:ScaleOutPolicyDescription'] :: ScaleOutPolicyDescription -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ScaleOutPolicyDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector scale out
--   to be triggered.

--   scale out to be triggered.
scaleOutPolicyDescription_cpuUtilizationPercentage :: Lens' ScaleOutPolicyDescription (Maybe Int)

module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScalingDescription

-- | Information about the auto scaling parameters for the connector.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScalingDescription</a> smart constructor.
data AutoScalingDescription
AutoScalingDescription' :: Maybe ScaleInPolicyDescription -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ScaleOutPolicyDescription -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> AutoScalingDescription

-- | The sacle-in policy for the connector.
[$sel:scaleInPolicy:AutoScalingDescription'] :: AutoScalingDescription -> Maybe ScaleInPolicyDescription

-- | The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector
--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
[$sel:mcuCount:AutoScalingDescription'] :: AutoScalingDescription -> Maybe Int

-- | The sacle-out policy for the connector.&gt;
[$sel:scaleOutPolicy:AutoScalingDescription'] :: AutoScalingDescription -> Maybe ScaleOutPolicyDescription

-- | The maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
[$sel:maxWorkerCount:AutoScalingDescription'] :: AutoScalingDescription -> Maybe Int

-- | The minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
[$sel:minWorkerCount:AutoScalingDescription'] :: AutoScalingDescription -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScalingDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleInPolicy:AutoScalingDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingDescription_scaleInPolicy</a> - The sacle-in policy for
--   the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mcuCount:AutoScalingDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingDescription_mcuCount</a> - The number of microcontroller
--   units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are
--   1,2,4,8.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleOutPolicy:AutoScalingDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingDescription_scaleOutPolicy</a> - The sacle-out policy
--   for the connector.&gt;
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxWorkerCount:AutoScalingDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingDescription_maxWorkerCount</a> - The maximum number of
--   workers allocated to the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minWorkerCount:AutoScalingDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingDescription_minWorkerCount</a> - The minimum number of
--   workers allocated to the connector.
newAutoScalingDescription :: AutoScalingDescription

-- | The sacle-in policy for the connector.
autoScalingDescription_scaleInPolicy :: Lens' AutoScalingDescription (Maybe ScaleInPolicyDescription)

-- | The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector
--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
autoScalingDescription_mcuCount :: Lens' AutoScalingDescription (Maybe Int)

-- | The sacle-out policy for the connector.&gt;
autoScalingDescription_scaleOutPolicy :: Lens' AutoScalingDescription (Maybe ScaleOutPolicyDescription)

-- | The maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
autoScalingDescription_maxWorkerCount :: Lens' AutoScalingDescription (Maybe Int)

-- | The minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
autoScalingDescription_minWorkerCount :: Lens' AutoScalingDescription (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScalingDescription.AutoScalingDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScalingDescription.AutoScalingDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScalingDescription.AutoScalingDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScalingDescription.AutoScalingDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScalingDescription.AutoScalingDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScalingDescription.AutoScalingDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScalingDescription.AutoScalingDescription


module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CapacityDescription

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCapacityDescription</a> smart constructor.
data CapacityDescription
CapacityDescription' :: Maybe AutoScalingDescription -> Maybe ProvisionedCapacityDescription -> CapacityDescription

-- | Describes the connector's auto scaling capacity.
[$sel:autoScaling:CapacityDescription'] :: CapacityDescription -> Maybe AutoScalingDescription

-- | Describes a connector's provisioned capacity.

--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>capacityDescription_autoScaling</a> - Describes the connector's
--   auto scaling capacity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedCapacity:CapacityDescription'</a>,
--   <a>capacityDescription_provisionedCapacity</a> - Describes a
--   connector's provisioned capacity.
newCapacityDescription :: CapacityDescription

-- | Describes the connector's auto scaling capacity.
capacityDescription_autoScaling :: Lens' CapacityDescription (Maybe AutoScalingDescription)

-- | Describes a connector's provisioned capacity.
capacityDescription_provisionedCapacity :: Lens' CapacityDescription (Maybe ProvisionedCapacityDescription)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CapacityDescription.CapacityDescription

module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ScaleOutPolicyUpdate

-- | An update to the connector's scale-out policy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScaleOutPolicyUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data ScaleOutPolicyUpdate

--   connector scale out to be triggered.

-- | Create a value of <a>ScaleOutPolicyUpdate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector scale out
--   to be triggered.

-- | The target CPU utilization percentage threshold at which you want
--   connector scale out to be triggered.
scaleOutPolicyUpdate_cpuUtilizationPercentage :: Lens' ScaleOutPolicyUpdate Natural
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ScaleOutPolicyUpdate.ScaleOutPolicyUpdate
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ScaleOutPolicyUpdate.ScaleOutPolicyUpdate
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ScaleOutPolicyUpdate.ScaleOutPolicyUpdate

module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScalingUpdate

-- | The updates to the auto scaling parameters for the connector.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScalingUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data AutoScalingUpdate
AutoScalingUpdate' :: Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> ScaleInPolicyUpdate -> ScaleOutPolicyUpdate -> AutoScalingUpdate

-- | The target maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
[$sel:maxWorkerCount:AutoScalingUpdate'] :: AutoScalingUpdate -> Natural

-- | The target number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each
--   connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
[$sel:mcuCount:AutoScalingUpdate'] :: AutoScalingUpdate -> Natural

-- | The target minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
[$sel:minWorkerCount:AutoScalingUpdate'] :: AutoScalingUpdate -> Natural

-- | The target sacle-in policy for the connector.
[$sel:scaleInPolicy:AutoScalingUpdate'] :: AutoScalingUpdate -> ScaleInPolicyUpdate

-- | The target sacle-out policy for the connector.
[$sel:scaleOutPolicy:AutoScalingUpdate'] :: AutoScalingUpdate -> ScaleOutPolicyUpdate

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScalingUpdate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxWorkerCount:AutoScalingUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingUpdate_maxWorkerCount</a> - The target maximum number of
--   workers allocated to the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mcuCount:AutoScalingUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingUpdate_mcuCount</a> - The target number of
--   microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The
--   valid values are 1,2,4,8.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minWorkerCount:AutoScalingUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingUpdate_minWorkerCount</a> - The target minimum number of
--   workers allocated to the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleInPolicy:AutoScalingUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingUpdate_scaleInPolicy</a> - The target sacle-in policy
--   for the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleOutPolicy:AutoScalingUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingUpdate_scaleOutPolicy</a> - The target sacle-out policy
--   for the connector.
newAutoScalingUpdate :: Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> ScaleInPolicyUpdate -> ScaleOutPolicyUpdate -> AutoScalingUpdate

-- | The target maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
autoScalingUpdate_maxWorkerCount :: Lens' AutoScalingUpdate Natural

-- | The target number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each
--   connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
autoScalingUpdate_mcuCount :: Lens' AutoScalingUpdate Natural

-- | The target minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
autoScalingUpdate_minWorkerCount :: Lens' AutoScalingUpdate Natural

-- | The target sacle-in policy for the connector.
autoScalingUpdate_scaleInPolicy :: Lens' AutoScalingUpdate ScaleInPolicyUpdate

-- | The target sacle-out policy for the connector.
autoScalingUpdate_scaleOutPolicy :: Lens' AutoScalingUpdate ScaleOutPolicyUpdate
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScalingUpdate.AutoScalingUpdate
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScalingUpdate.AutoScalingUpdate
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScalingUpdate.AutoScalingUpdate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScalingUpdate.AutoScalingUpdate
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScalingUpdate.AutoScalingUpdate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScalingUpdate.AutoScalingUpdate
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.AutoScalingUpdate.AutoScalingUpdate


module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CapacityUpdate

-- | The target capacity for the connector. The capacity can be auto scaled
--   or provisioned.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCapacityUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data CapacityUpdate
CapacityUpdate' :: Maybe AutoScalingUpdate -> Maybe ProvisionedCapacityUpdate -> CapacityUpdate

-- | The target auto scaling setting.
[$sel:autoScaling:CapacityUpdate'] :: CapacityUpdate -> Maybe AutoScalingUpdate

-- | The target settings for provisioned capacity.
[$sel:provisionedCapacity:CapacityUpdate'] :: CapacityUpdate -> Maybe ProvisionedCapacityUpdate

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScaling:CapacityUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>capacityUpdate_autoScaling</a> - The target auto scaling setting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedCapacity:CapacityUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>capacityUpdate_provisionedCapacity</a> - The target settings for
--   provisioned capacity.
newCapacityUpdate :: CapacityUpdate

-- | The target auto scaling setting.
capacityUpdate_autoScaling :: Lens' CapacityUpdate (Maybe AutoScalingUpdate)

-- | The target settings for provisioned capacity.
capacityUpdate_provisionedCapacity :: Lens' CapacityUpdate (Maybe ProvisionedCapacityUpdate)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CapacityUpdate.CapacityUpdate
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CapacityUpdate.CapacityUpdate

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CapacityUpdate.CapacityUpdate
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.CapacityUpdate.CapacityUpdate

module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.Vpc

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVpc</a> smart constructor.
data Vpc

-- | The security groups for the connector.
[$sel:securityGroups:Vpc'] :: Vpc -> Maybe [Text]

[$sel:subnets:Vpc'] :: Vpc -> [Text]

--

--

--   connector.

-- | The subnets for the connector.
vpc_subnets :: Lens' Vpc [Text]

module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ApacheKafkaCluster

-- | The details of the Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is
--   connected.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApacheKafkaCluster</a> smart constructor.
data ApacheKafkaCluster
ApacheKafkaCluster' :: Text -> Vpc -> ApacheKafkaCluster

-- | The bootstrap servers of the cluster.
[$sel:bootstrapServers:ApacheKafkaCluster'] :: ApacheKafkaCluster -> Text

-- | Details of an Amazon VPC which has network connectivity to the Apache
--   Kafka cluster.
[$sel:vpc:ApacheKafkaCluster'] :: ApacheKafkaCluster -> Vpc

-- | Create a value of <a>ApacheKafkaCluster</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bootstrapServers:ApacheKafkaCluster'</a>,
--   <a>apacheKafkaCluster_bootstrapServers</a> - The bootstrap servers of
--   the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpc:ApacheKafkaCluster'</a>, <a>apacheKafkaCluster_vpc</a> -
--   Details of an Amazon VPC which has network connectivity to the Apache
--   Kafka cluster.
newApacheKafkaCluster :: Text -> Vpc -> ApacheKafkaCluster

-- | The bootstrap servers of the cluster.
apacheKafkaCluster_bootstrapServers :: Lens' ApacheKafkaCluster Text

-- | Details of an Amazon VPC which has network connectivity to the Apache
--   Kafka cluster.
apacheKafkaCluster_vpc :: Lens' ApacheKafkaCluster Vpc
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ApacheKafkaCluster.ApacheKafkaCluster
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ApacheKafkaCluster.ApacheKafkaCluster
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ApacheKafkaCluster.ApacheKafkaCluster
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ApacheKafkaCluster.ApacheKafkaCluster

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ApacheKafkaCluster.ApacheKafkaCluster

module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.VpcDescription

-- | The description of the VPC in which the connector resides.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVpcDescription</a> smart constructor.
data VpcDescription
VpcDescription' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> VpcDescription

-- | The security groups for the connector.
[$sel:securityGroups:VpcDescription'] :: VpcDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The subnets for the connector.
[$sel:subnets:VpcDescription'] :: VpcDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>VpcDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroups:VpcDescription'</a>,
--   <a>vpcDescription_securityGroups</a> - The security groups for the
--   connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnets:VpcDescription'</a>, <a>vpcDescription_subnets</a> -
--   The subnets for the connector.
newVpcDescription :: VpcDescription

-- | The security groups for the connector.
vpcDescription_securityGroups :: Lens' VpcDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The subnets for the connector.
vpcDescription_subnets :: Lens' VpcDescription (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.VpcDescription.VpcDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.VpcDescription.VpcDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.VpcDescription.VpcDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.VpcDescription.VpcDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.VpcDescription.VpcDescription

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.VpcDescription.VpcDescription

module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.WorkerConfiguration

-- | The configuration of the workers, which are the processes that run the
--   connector logic.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkerConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data WorkerConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the worker configuration.

--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   configuration.
--

--   <a>workerConfiguration_workerConfigurationArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the worker configuration.
newWorkerConfiguration :: Natural -> Text -> WorkerConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the worker configuration.
workerConfiguration_workerConfigurationArn :: Lens' WorkerConfiguration Text

module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.WorkerLogDelivery

-- | Workers can send worker logs to different destination types. This
--   configuration specifies the details of these destinations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkerLogDelivery</a> smart constructor.
data WorkerLogDelivery
WorkerLogDelivery' :: Maybe CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery -> Maybe FirehoseLogDelivery -> Maybe S3LogDelivery -> WorkerLogDelivery

-- | Details about delivering logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:cloudWatchLogs:WorkerLogDelivery'] :: WorkerLogDelivery -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery

-- | Details about delivering logs to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.
[$sel:firehose:WorkerLogDelivery'] :: WorkerLogDelivery -> Maybe FirehoseLogDelivery

-- | Details about delivering logs to Amazon S3.
[$sel:s3:WorkerLogDelivery'] :: WorkerLogDelivery -> Maybe S3LogDelivery

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkerLogDelivery</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLogs:WorkerLogDelivery'</a>,
--   <a>workerLogDelivery_cloudWatchLogs</a> - Details about delivering
--   logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:firehose:WorkerLogDelivery'</a>,
--   <a>workerLogDelivery_firehose</a> - Details about delivering logs to
--   Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3:WorkerLogDelivery'</a>, <a>workerLogDelivery_s3</a> -
--   Details about delivering logs to Amazon S3.
newWorkerLogDelivery :: WorkerLogDelivery

-- | Details about delivering logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
workerLogDelivery_cloudWatchLogs :: Lens' WorkerLogDelivery (Maybe CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery)

-- | Details about delivering logs to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.
workerLogDelivery_firehose :: Lens' WorkerLogDelivery (Maybe FirehoseLogDelivery)

-- | Details about delivering logs to Amazon S3.
workerLogDelivery_s3 :: Lens' WorkerLogDelivery (Maybe S3LogDelivery)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.WorkerLogDelivery.WorkerLogDelivery
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.WorkerLogDelivery.WorkerLogDelivery
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.WorkerLogDelivery.WorkerLogDelivery
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.WorkerLogDelivery.WorkerLogDelivery

-- | The description of the log delivery settings.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLogDeliveryDescription</a> smart constructor.
data LogDeliveryDescription

-- | The workers can send worker logs to different destination types. This
--   configuration specifies the details of these destinations.

-- | Create a value of <a>LogDeliveryDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:workerLogDelivery:LogDeliveryDescription'</a>,
--   <a>logDeliveryDescription_workerLogDelivery</a> - The workers can send
--   worker logs to different destination types. This configuration
--   specifies the details of these destinations.
newLogDeliveryDescription :: LogDeliveryDescription

-- | The workers can send worker logs to different destination types. This
--   configuration specifies the details of these destinations.
logDeliveryDescription_workerLogDelivery :: Lens' LogDeliveryDescription (Maybe WorkerLogDeliveryDescription)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.LogDeliveryDescription.LogDeliveryDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.LogDeliveryDescription.LogDeliveryDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.LogDeliveryDescription.LogDeliveryDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.LogDeliveryDescription.LogDeliveryDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.LogDeliveryDescription.LogDeliveryDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.LogDeliveryDescription.LogDeliveryDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.LogDeliveryDescription.LogDeliveryDescription


module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ConnectorSummary

-- | Summary of a connector.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newConnectorSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ConnectorSummary
ConnectorSummary' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe KafkaClusterDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe LogDeliveryDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe WorkerConfigurationDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ConnectorState -> Maybe CapacityDescription -> Maybe [PluginDescription] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationDescription -> Maybe KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitDescription -> Maybe Text -> ConnectorSummary

-- | The time that the connector was created.
[$sel:creationTime:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The details of the Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is
--   connected.
[$sel:kafkaCluster:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe KafkaClusterDescription

-- | The version of Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the
--   Apache Kafka cluster's version and the plugins.
[$sel:kafkaConnectVersion:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The settings for delivering connector logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:logDelivery:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe LogDeliveryDescription

-- | The current version of the connector.
[$sel:currentVersion:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The worker configurations that are in use with the connector.
[$sel:workerConfiguration:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe WorkerConfigurationDescription

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connector.
[$sel:connectorArn:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the connector.
[$sel:connectorName:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The state of the connector.
[$sel:connectorState:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe ConnectorState

-- | The connector's compute capacity settings.
[$sel:capacity:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe CapacityDescription

-- | Specifies which plugins were used for this connector.
[$sel:plugins:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe [PluginDescription]

-- | The description of the connector.
[$sel:connectorDescription:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka
--   cluster. The value is NONE when no client authentication is used.
[$sel:kafkaClusterClientAuthentication:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationDescription

-- | Details of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.
[$sel:kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitDescription

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector
--   to access Amazon Web Services resources.
[$sel:serviceExecutionRoleArn:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ConnectorSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_creationTime</a> - The time that the connector was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaCluster:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_kafkaCluster</a> - The details of the Apache Kafka
--   cluster to which the connector is connected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaConnectVersion:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_kafkaConnectVersion</a> - The version of Kafka
--   Connect. It has to be compatible with both the Apache Kafka cluster's
--   version and the plugins.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logDelivery:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_logDelivery</a> - The settings for delivering
--   connector logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentVersion:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_currentVersion</a> - The current version of the
--   connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workerConfiguration:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_workerConfiguration</a> - The worker
--   configurations that are in use with the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorArn:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_connectorArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorName:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_connectorName</a> - The name of the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorState:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_connectorState</a> - The state of the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:capacity:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_capacity</a> - The connector's compute capacity
--   settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:plugins:ConnectorSummary'</a>, <a>connectorSummary_plugins</a>
--   - Specifies which plugins were used for this connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorDescription:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_connectorDescription</a> - The description of the
--   connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaClusterClientAuthentication:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_kafkaClusterClientAuthentication</a> - The type of
--   client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka cluster. The
--   value is NONE when no client authentication is used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit</a> - Details of
--   encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceExecutionRoleArn:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_serviceExecutionRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector to access Amazon Web
--   Services resources.
newConnectorSummary :: ConnectorSummary

-- | The time that the connector was created.
connectorSummary_creationTime :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The details of the Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is
--   connected.
connectorSummary_kafkaCluster :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe KafkaClusterDescription)

-- | The version of Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the
--   Apache Kafka cluster's version and the plugins.
connectorSummary_kafkaConnectVersion :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The settings for delivering connector logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
connectorSummary_logDelivery :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe LogDeliveryDescription)

-- | The current version of the connector.
connectorSummary_currentVersion :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The worker configurations that are in use with the connector.
connectorSummary_workerConfiguration :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe WorkerConfigurationDescription)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connector.
connectorSummary_connectorArn :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the connector.
connectorSummary_connectorName :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The state of the connector.
connectorSummary_connectorState :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe ConnectorState)

-- | The connector's compute capacity settings.
connectorSummary_capacity :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe CapacityDescription)

-- | Specifies which plugins were used for this connector.
connectorSummary_plugins :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe [PluginDescription])

-- | The description of the connector.
connectorSummary_connectorDescription :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka
--   cluster. The value is NONE when no client authentication is used.
connectorSummary_kafkaClusterClientAuthentication :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationDescription)

-- | Details of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.
connectorSummary_kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitDescription)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector
--   to access Amazon Web Services resources.
connectorSummary_serviceExecutionRoleArn :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ConnectorSummary.ConnectorSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ConnectorSummary.ConnectorSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ConnectorSummary.ConnectorSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ConnectorSummary.ConnectorSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ConnectorSummary.ConnectorSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ConnectorSummary.ConnectorSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types.ConnectorSummary.ConnectorSummary


module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Types

-- | API version <tt>2021-09-14</tt> of the Amazon Managed Streaming for
--   Kafka Connect SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | HTTP Status Code 409: Conflict. A resource with this name already
--   exists. Retry your request with another name.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | HTTP Status Code 403: Access forbidden. Correct your credentials and
--   then retry your request.
_ForbiddenException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | HTTP Status Code 404: Resource not found due to incorrect input.
--   Correct your request and then retry it.
_NotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | HTTP Status Code 429: Limit exceeded. Resource limit reached.
_TooManyRequestsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | HTTP Status Code 500: Unexpected internal server error. Retrying your
--   request might resolve the issue.
_InternalServerErrorException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | HTTP Status Code 503: Service Unavailable. Retrying your request in
--   some time might resolve the issue.
_ServiceUnavailableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | HTTP Status Code 401: Unauthorized request. The provided credentials
--   couldn't be validated.
_UnauthorizedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | HTTP Status Code 400: Bad request due to incorrect input. Correct your
--   request and then retry it.
_BadRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
newtype ConnectorState
ConnectorState' :: Text -> ConnectorState
[fromConnectorState] :: ConnectorState -> Text
pattern ConnectorState_CREATING :: ConnectorState
pattern ConnectorState_DELETING :: ConnectorState
pattern ConnectorState_FAILED :: ConnectorState
pattern ConnectorState_RUNNING :: ConnectorState
pattern ConnectorState_UPDATING :: ConnectorState
newtype CustomPluginContentType
CustomPluginContentType' :: Text -> CustomPluginContentType
[fromCustomPluginContentType] :: CustomPluginContentType -> Text
pattern CustomPluginContentType_JAR :: CustomPluginContentType
pattern CustomPluginContentType_ZIP :: CustomPluginContentType
newtype CustomPluginState
CustomPluginState' :: Text -> CustomPluginState
[fromCustomPluginState] :: CustomPluginState -> Text
pattern CustomPluginState_ACTIVE :: CustomPluginState
pattern CustomPluginState_CREATE_FAILED :: CustomPluginState
pattern CustomPluginState_CREATING :: CustomPluginState
pattern CustomPluginState_DELETING :: CustomPluginState
pattern CustomPluginState_UPDATE_FAILED :: CustomPluginState
pattern CustomPluginState_UPDATING :: CustomPluginState
newtype KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType
KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType' :: Text -> KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType
[fromKafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType] :: KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType -> Text
pattern KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType_IAM :: KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType
pattern KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType_NONE :: KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType
newtype KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitType
KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitType' :: Text -> KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitType
[fromKafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitType] :: KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitType -> Text
pattern KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitType_PLAINTEXT :: KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitType
pattern KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitType_TLS :: KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitType

-- | The details of the Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is
--   connected.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApacheKafkaCluster</a> smart constructor.
data ApacheKafkaCluster
ApacheKafkaCluster' :: Text -> Vpc -> ApacheKafkaCluster

-- | The bootstrap servers of the cluster.
[$sel:bootstrapServers:ApacheKafkaCluster'] :: ApacheKafkaCluster -> Text

-- | Details of an Amazon VPC which has network connectivity to the Apache
--   Kafka cluster.
[$sel:vpc:ApacheKafkaCluster'] :: ApacheKafkaCluster -> Vpc

-- | Create a value of <a>ApacheKafkaCluster</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bootstrapServers:ApacheKafkaCluster'</a>,
--   <a>apacheKafkaCluster_bootstrapServers</a> - The bootstrap servers of
--   the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpc:ApacheKafkaCluster'</a>, <a>apacheKafkaCluster_vpc</a> -
--   Details of an Amazon VPC which has network connectivity to the Apache
--   Kafka cluster.
newApacheKafkaCluster :: Text -> Vpc -> ApacheKafkaCluster

-- | The bootstrap servers of the cluster.
apacheKafkaCluster_bootstrapServers :: Lens' ApacheKafkaCluster Text

-- | Details of an Amazon VPC which has network connectivity to the Apache
--   Kafka cluster.
apacheKafkaCluster_vpc :: Lens' ApacheKafkaCluster Vpc

-- | The description of the Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is
--   connected.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApacheKafkaClusterDescription</a> smart constructor.
data ApacheKafkaClusterDescription
ApacheKafkaClusterDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe VpcDescription -> ApacheKafkaClusterDescription

-- | The bootstrap servers of the cluster.
[$sel:bootstrapServers:ApacheKafkaClusterDescription'] :: ApacheKafkaClusterDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Details of an Amazon VPC which has network connectivity to the Apache
--   Kafka cluster.
[$sel:vpc:ApacheKafkaClusterDescription'] :: ApacheKafkaClusterDescription -> Maybe VpcDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>ApacheKafkaClusterDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bootstrapServers:ApacheKafkaClusterDescription'</a>,

--   servers of the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpc:ApacheKafkaClusterDescription'</a>,
--   <a>apacheKafkaClusterDescription_vpc</a> - Details of an Amazon VPC
--   which has network connectivity to the Apache Kafka cluster.
newApacheKafkaClusterDescription :: ApacheKafkaClusterDescription

-- | The bootstrap servers of the cluster.
apacheKafkaClusterDescription_bootstrapServers :: Lens' ApacheKafkaClusterDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Details of an Amazon VPC which has network connectivity to the Apache
--   Kafka cluster.
apacheKafkaClusterDescription_vpc :: Lens' ApacheKafkaClusterDescription (Maybe VpcDescription)

-- | Specifies how the connector scales.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScaling</a> smart constructor.
data AutoScaling
AutoScaling' :: Maybe ScaleInPolicy -> Maybe ScaleOutPolicy -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> AutoScaling

-- | The sacle-in policy for the connector.
[$sel:scaleInPolicy:AutoScaling'] :: AutoScaling -> Maybe ScaleInPolicy

-- | The sacle-out policy for the connector.
[$sel:scaleOutPolicy:AutoScaling'] :: AutoScaling -> Maybe ScaleOutPolicy

-- | The maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
[$sel:maxWorkerCount:AutoScaling'] :: AutoScaling -> Natural

-- | The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector
--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
[$sel:mcuCount:AutoScaling'] :: AutoScaling -> Natural

-- | The minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
[$sel:minWorkerCount:AutoScaling'] :: AutoScaling -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScaling</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleInPolicy:AutoScaling'</a>,
--   <a>autoScaling_scaleInPolicy</a> - The sacle-in policy for the
--   connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleOutPolicy:AutoScaling'</a>,
--   <a>autoScaling_scaleOutPolicy</a> - The sacle-out policy for the
--   connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxWorkerCount:AutoScaling'</a>,
--   <a>autoScaling_maxWorkerCount</a> - The maximum number of workers
--   allocated to the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mcuCount:AutoScaling'</a>, <a>autoScaling_mcuCount</a> - The
--   number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector
--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minWorkerCount:AutoScaling'</a>,
--   <a>autoScaling_minWorkerCount</a> - The minimum number of workers
--   allocated to the connector.
newAutoScaling :: Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> AutoScaling

-- | The sacle-in policy for the connector.
autoScaling_scaleInPolicy :: Lens' AutoScaling (Maybe ScaleInPolicy)

-- | The sacle-out policy for the connector.
autoScaling_scaleOutPolicy :: Lens' AutoScaling (Maybe ScaleOutPolicy)

-- | The maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
autoScaling_maxWorkerCount :: Lens' AutoScaling Natural

-- | The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector
--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
autoScaling_mcuCount :: Lens' AutoScaling Natural

-- | The minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
autoScaling_minWorkerCount :: Lens' AutoScaling Natural

-- | Information about the auto scaling parameters for the connector.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScalingDescription</a> smart constructor.
data AutoScalingDescription
AutoScalingDescription' :: Maybe ScaleInPolicyDescription -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ScaleOutPolicyDescription -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> AutoScalingDescription

-- | The sacle-in policy for the connector.
[$sel:scaleInPolicy:AutoScalingDescription'] :: AutoScalingDescription -> Maybe ScaleInPolicyDescription

-- | The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector
--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
[$sel:mcuCount:AutoScalingDescription'] :: AutoScalingDescription -> Maybe Int

-- | The sacle-out policy for the connector.&gt;
[$sel:scaleOutPolicy:AutoScalingDescription'] :: AutoScalingDescription -> Maybe ScaleOutPolicyDescription

-- | The maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
[$sel:maxWorkerCount:AutoScalingDescription'] :: AutoScalingDescription -> Maybe Int

-- | The minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
[$sel:minWorkerCount:AutoScalingDescription'] :: AutoScalingDescription -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScalingDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleInPolicy:AutoScalingDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingDescription_scaleInPolicy</a> - The sacle-in policy for
--   the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mcuCount:AutoScalingDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingDescription_mcuCount</a> - The number of microcontroller
--   units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are
--   1,2,4,8.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleOutPolicy:AutoScalingDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingDescription_scaleOutPolicy</a> - The sacle-out policy
--   for the connector.&gt;
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxWorkerCount:AutoScalingDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingDescription_maxWorkerCount</a> - The maximum number of
--   workers allocated to the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minWorkerCount:AutoScalingDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingDescription_minWorkerCount</a> - The minimum number of
--   workers allocated to the connector.
newAutoScalingDescription :: AutoScalingDescription

-- | The sacle-in policy for the connector.
autoScalingDescription_scaleInPolicy :: Lens' AutoScalingDescription (Maybe ScaleInPolicyDescription)

-- | The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector
--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
autoScalingDescription_mcuCount :: Lens' AutoScalingDescription (Maybe Int)

-- | The sacle-out policy for the connector.&gt;
autoScalingDescription_scaleOutPolicy :: Lens' AutoScalingDescription (Maybe ScaleOutPolicyDescription)

-- | The maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
autoScalingDescription_maxWorkerCount :: Lens' AutoScalingDescription (Maybe Int)

-- | The minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
autoScalingDescription_minWorkerCount :: Lens' AutoScalingDescription (Maybe Int)

-- | The updates to the auto scaling parameters for the connector.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScalingUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data AutoScalingUpdate
AutoScalingUpdate' :: Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> ScaleInPolicyUpdate -> ScaleOutPolicyUpdate -> AutoScalingUpdate

-- | The target maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
[$sel:maxWorkerCount:AutoScalingUpdate'] :: AutoScalingUpdate -> Natural

-- | The target number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each
--   connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
[$sel:mcuCount:AutoScalingUpdate'] :: AutoScalingUpdate -> Natural

-- | The target minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
[$sel:minWorkerCount:AutoScalingUpdate'] :: AutoScalingUpdate -> Natural

-- | The target sacle-in policy for the connector.
[$sel:scaleInPolicy:AutoScalingUpdate'] :: AutoScalingUpdate -> ScaleInPolicyUpdate

-- | The target sacle-out policy for the connector.
[$sel:scaleOutPolicy:AutoScalingUpdate'] :: AutoScalingUpdate -> ScaleOutPolicyUpdate

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScalingUpdate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxWorkerCount:AutoScalingUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingUpdate_maxWorkerCount</a> - The target maximum number of
--   workers allocated to the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mcuCount:AutoScalingUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingUpdate_mcuCount</a> - The target number of
--   microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The
--   valid values are 1,2,4,8.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minWorkerCount:AutoScalingUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingUpdate_minWorkerCount</a> - The target minimum number of
--   workers allocated to the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleInPolicy:AutoScalingUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingUpdate_scaleInPolicy</a> - The target sacle-in policy
--   for the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleOutPolicy:AutoScalingUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingUpdate_scaleOutPolicy</a> - The target sacle-out policy
--   for the connector.
newAutoScalingUpdate :: Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> ScaleInPolicyUpdate -> ScaleOutPolicyUpdate -> AutoScalingUpdate

-- | The target maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
autoScalingUpdate_maxWorkerCount :: Lens' AutoScalingUpdate Natural

-- | The target number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each
--   connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
autoScalingUpdate_mcuCount :: Lens' AutoScalingUpdate Natural

-- | The target minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
autoScalingUpdate_minWorkerCount :: Lens' AutoScalingUpdate Natural

-- | The target sacle-in policy for the connector.
autoScalingUpdate_scaleInPolicy :: Lens' AutoScalingUpdate ScaleInPolicyUpdate

-- | The target sacle-out policy for the connector.
autoScalingUpdate_scaleOutPolicy :: Lens' AutoScalingUpdate ScaleOutPolicyUpdate

-- | Information about the capacity of the connector, whether it is auto
--   scaled or provisioned.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCapacity</a> smart constructor.
data Capacity
Capacity' :: Maybe AutoScaling -> Maybe ProvisionedCapacity -> Capacity

-- | Information about the auto scaling parameters for the connector.
[$sel:autoScaling:Capacity'] :: Capacity -> Maybe AutoScaling

-- | Details about a fixed capacity allocated to a connector.
[$sel:provisionedCapacity:Capacity'] :: Capacity -> Maybe ProvisionedCapacity

-- | Create a value of <a>Capacity</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScaling:Capacity'</a>, <a>capacity_autoScaling</a> -
--   Information about the auto scaling parameters for the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedCapacity:Capacity'</a>,
--   <a>capacity_provisionedCapacity</a> - Details about a fixed capacity
--   allocated to a connector.
newCapacity :: Capacity

-- | Information about the auto scaling parameters for the connector.
capacity_autoScaling :: Lens' Capacity (Maybe AutoScaling)

-- | Details about a fixed capacity allocated to a connector.
capacity_provisionedCapacity :: Lens' Capacity (Maybe ProvisionedCapacity)

-- | A description of the connector's capacity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCapacityDescription</a> smart constructor.
data CapacityDescription
CapacityDescription' :: Maybe AutoScalingDescription -> Maybe ProvisionedCapacityDescription -> CapacityDescription

-- | Describes the connector's auto scaling capacity.
[$sel:autoScaling:CapacityDescription'] :: CapacityDescription -> Maybe AutoScalingDescription

-- | Describes a connector's provisioned capacity.
[$sel:provisionedCapacity:CapacityDescription'] :: CapacityDescription -> Maybe ProvisionedCapacityDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>CapacityDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScaling:CapacityDescription'</a>,
--   <a>capacityDescription_autoScaling</a> - Describes the connector's
--   auto scaling capacity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedCapacity:CapacityDescription'</a>,
--   <a>capacityDescription_provisionedCapacity</a> - Describes a
--   connector's provisioned capacity.
newCapacityDescription :: CapacityDescription

-- | Describes the connector's auto scaling capacity.
capacityDescription_autoScaling :: Lens' CapacityDescription (Maybe AutoScalingDescription)

-- | Describes a connector's provisioned capacity.
capacityDescription_provisionedCapacity :: Lens' CapacityDescription (Maybe ProvisionedCapacityDescription)

-- | The target capacity for the connector. The capacity can be auto scaled
--   or provisioned.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCapacityUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data CapacityUpdate
CapacityUpdate' :: Maybe AutoScalingUpdate -> Maybe ProvisionedCapacityUpdate -> CapacityUpdate

-- | The target auto scaling setting.
[$sel:autoScaling:CapacityUpdate'] :: CapacityUpdate -> Maybe AutoScalingUpdate

-- | The target settings for provisioned capacity.
[$sel:provisionedCapacity:CapacityUpdate'] :: CapacityUpdate -> Maybe ProvisionedCapacityUpdate

-- | Create a value of <a>CapacityUpdate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScaling:CapacityUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>capacityUpdate_autoScaling</a> - The target auto scaling setting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedCapacity:CapacityUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>capacityUpdate_provisionedCapacity</a> - The target settings for
--   provisioned capacity.
newCapacityUpdate :: CapacityUpdate

-- | The target auto scaling setting.
capacityUpdate_autoScaling :: Lens' CapacityUpdate (Maybe AutoScalingUpdate)

-- | The target settings for provisioned capacity.
capacityUpdate_provisionedCapacity :: Lens' CapacityUpdate (Maybe ProvisionedCapacityUpdate)

-- | The settings for delivering connector logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchLogsLogDelivery</a> smart constructor.
data CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery
CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery' :: Maybe Text -> Bool -> CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery

-- | The name of the CloudWatch log group that is the destination for log
--   delivery.
[$sel:logGroup:CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery'] :: CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery -> Maybe Text

-- | Whether log delivery to Amazon CloudWatch Logs is enabled.
[$sel:enabled:CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery'] :: CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:logGroup:CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsLogDelivery_logGroup</a> - The name of the CloudWatch
--   log group that is the destination for log delivery.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsLogDelivery_enabled</a> - Whether log delivery to
--   Amazon CloudWatch Logs is enabled.
newCloudWatchLogsLogDelivery :: Bool -> CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery

-- | The name of the CloudWatch log group that is the destination for log
--   delivery.
cloudWatchLogsLogDelivery_logGroup :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether log delivery to Amazon CloudWatch Logs is enabled.
cloudWatchLogsLogDelivery_enabled :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery Bool

-- | A description of the log delivery settings.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription
CloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> CloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription

-- | Whether log delivery to Amazon CloudWatch Logs is enabled.
[$sel:enabled:CloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription'] :: CloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the CloudWatch log group that is the destination for log
--   delivery.
[$sel:logGroup:CloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription'] :: CloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
