--   delivery to Amazon CloudWatch Logs is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logGroup:CloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription_logGroup</a> - The name of the
--   CloudWatch log group that is the destination for log delivery.
newCloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription :: CloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription

-- | Whether log delivery to Amazon CloudWatch Logs is enabled.
cloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription_enabled :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the CloudWatch log group that is the destination for log
--   delivery.
cloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription_logGroup :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Summary of a connector.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newConnectorSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ConnectorSummary
ConnectorSummary' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe KafkaClusterDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe LogDeliveryDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe WorkerConfigurationDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ConnectorState -> Maybe CapacityDescription -> Maybe [PluginDescription] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationDescription -> Maybe KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitDescription -> Maybe Text -> ConnectorSummary

-- | The time that the connector was created.
[$sel:creationTime:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The details of the Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is
--   connected.
[$sel:kafkaCluster:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe KafkaClusterDescription

-- | The version of Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the
--   Apache Kafka cluster's version and the plugins.
[$sel:kafkaConnectVersion:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The settings for delivering connector logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:logDelivery:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe LogDeliveryDescription

-- | The current version of the connector.
[$sel:currentVersion:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The worker configurations that are in use with the connector.
[$sel:workerConfiguration:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe WorkerConfigurationDescription

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connector.
[$sel:connectorArn:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the connector.
[$sel:connectorName:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The state of the connector.
[$sel:connectorState:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe ConnectorState

-- | The connector's compute capacity settings.
[$sel:capacity:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe CapacityDescription

-- | Specifies which plugins were used for this connector.
[$sel:plugins:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe [PluginDescription]

-- | The description of the connector.
[$sel:connectorDescription:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka
--   cluster. The value is NONE when no client authentication is used.
[$sel:kafkaClusterClientAuthentication:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationDescription

-- | Details of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.
[$sel:kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitDescription

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector
--   to access Amazon Web Services resources.
[$sel:serviceExecutionRoleArn:ConnectorSummary'] :: ConnectorSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ConnectorSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_creationTime</a> - The time that the connector was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaCluster:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_kafkaCluster</a> - The details of the Apache Kafka
--   cluster to which the connector is connected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaConnectVersion:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_kafkaConnectVersion</a> - The version of Kafka
--   Connect. It has to be compatible with both the Apache Kafka cluster's
--   version and the plugins.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logDelivery:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_logDelivery</a> - The settings for delivering
--   connector logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentVersion:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_currentVersion</a> - The current version of the
--   connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workerConfiguration:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_workerConfiguration</a> - The worker
--   configurations that are in use with the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorArn:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_connectorArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorName:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_connectorName</a> - The name of the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorState:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_connectorState</a> - The state of the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:capacity:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_capacity</a> - The connector's compute capacity
--   settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:plugins:ConnectorSummary'</a>, <a>connectorSummary_plugins</a>
--   - Specifies which plugins were used for this connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorDescription:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_connectorDescription</a> - The description of the
--   connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaClusterClientAuthentication:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_kafkaClusterClientAuthentication</a> - The type of
--   client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka cluster. The
--   value is NONE when no client authentication is used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit</a> - Details of
--   encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceExecutionRoleArn:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_serviceExecutionRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector to access Amazon Web
--   Services resources.
newConnectorSummary :: ConnectorSummary

-- | The time that the connector was created.
connectorSummary_creationTime :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The details of the Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is
--   connected.
connectorSummary_kafkaCluster :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe KafkaClusterDescription)

-- | The version of Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the
--   Apache Kafka cluster's version and the plugins.
connectorSummary_kafkaConnectVersion :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The settings for delivering connector logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
connectorSummary_logDelivery :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe LogDeliveryDescription)

-- | The current version of the connector.
connectorSummary_currentVersion :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The worker configurations that are in use with the connector.
connectorSummary_workerConfiguration :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe WorkerConfigurationDescription)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connector.
connectorSummary_connectorArn :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the connector.
connectorSummary_connectorName :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The state of the connector.
connectorSummary_connectorState :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe ConnectorState)

-- | The connector's compute capacity settings.
connectorSummary_capacity :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe CapacityDescription)

-- | Specifies which plugins were used for this connector.
connectorSummary_plugins :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe [PluginDescription])

-- | The description of the connector.
connectorSummary_connectorDescription :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka
--   cluster. The value is NONE when no client authentication is used.
connectorSummary_kafkaClusterClientAuthentication :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationDescription)

-- | Details of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.
connectorSummary_kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitDescription)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector
--   to access Amazon Web Services resources.
connectorSummary_serviceExecutionRoleArn :: Lens' ConnectorSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | A plugin is an AWS resource that contains the code that defines a
--   connector's logic.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomPlugin</a> smart constructor.
data CustomPlugin
CustomPlugin' :: Text -> Natural -> CustomPlugin

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom plugin.
[$sel:customPluginArn:CustomPlugin'] :: CustomPlugin -> Text

-- | The revision of the custom plugin.
[$sel:revision:CustomPlugin'] :: CustomPlugin -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomPlugin</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customPluginArn:CustomPlugin'</a>,
--   <a>customPlugin_customPluginArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the custom plugin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:revision:CustomPlugin'</a>, <a>customPlugin_revision</a> - The
--   revision of the custom plugin.
newCustomPlugin :: Text -> Natural -> CustomPlugin

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom plugin.
customPlugin_customPluginArn :: Lens' CustomPlugin Text

-- | The revision of the custom plugin.
customPlugin_revision :: Lens' CustomPlugin Natural

--   validate the file.

-- | A summary of the custom plugin.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomPluginSummary</a> smart constructor.
data CustomPluginSummary
CustomPluginSummary' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe CustomPluginRevisionSummary -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CustomPluginState -> Maybe Text -> CustomPluginSummary

[$sel:creationTime:CustomPluginSummary'] :: CustomPluginSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The latest revision of the custom plugin.
[$sel:latestRevision:CustomPluginSummary'] :: CustomPluginSummary -> Maybe CustomPluginRevisionSummary

[$sel:name:CustomPluginSummary'] :: CustomPluginSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom plugin.
[$sel:customPluginArn:CustomPluginSummary'] :: CustomPluginSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The state of the custom plugin.
[$sel:customPluginState:CustomPluginSummary'] :: CustomPluginSummary -> Maybe CustomPluginState

-- | A description of the custom plugin.
[$sel:description:CustomPluginSummary'] :: CustomPluginSummary -> Maybe Text

--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   plugin was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:latestRevision:CustomPluginSummary'</a>,
--   <a>customPluginSummary_latestRevision</a> - The latest revision of the
--   custom plugin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CustomPluginSummary'</a>, <a>customPluginSummary_name</a>
--   - The name of the custom plugin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customPluginArn:CustomPluginSummary'</a>,
--   <a>customPluginSummary_customPluginArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the custom plugin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customPluginState:CustomPluginSummary'</a>,
--   <a>customPluginSummary_customPluginState</a> - The state of the custom
--   plugin.

--   plugin.

-- | The settings for delivering logs to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFirehoseLogDelivery</a> smart constructor.
data FirehoseLogDelivery
FirehoseLogDelivery' :: Maybe Text -> Bool -> FirehoseLogDelivery

-- | The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream that is the
--   destination for log delivery.
[$sel:deliveryStream:FirehoseLogDelivery'] :: FirehoseLogDelivery -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether connector logs get delivered to Amazon Kinesis Data
--   Firehose.
[$sel:enabled:FirehoseLogDelivery'] :: FirehoseLogDelivery -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>FirehoseLogDelivery</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStream:FirehoseLogDelivery'</a>,
--   <a>firehoseLogDelivery_deliveryStream</a> - The name of the Kinesis
--   Data Firehose delivery stream that is the destination for log
--   delivery.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:FirehoseLogDelivery'</a>,
--   <a>firehoseLogDelivery_enabled</a> - Specifies whether connector logs
--   get delivered to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.
newFirehoseLogDelivery :: Bool -> FirehoseLogDelivery

-- | The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream that is the
--   destination for log delivery.
firehoseLogDelivery_deliveryStream :: Lens' FirehoseLogDelivery (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether connector logs get delivered to Amazon Kinesis Data
--   Firehose.
firehoseLogDelivery_enabled :: Lens' FirehoseLogDelivery Bool

--   Data Firehose.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFirehoseLogDeliveryDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data FirehoseLogDeliveryDescription

--   Firehose.
[$sel:enabled:FirehoseLogDeliveryDescription'] :: FirehoseLogDeliveryDescription -> Maybe Bool

--   destination for log delivery.
[$sel:deliveryStream:FirehoseLogDeliveryDescription'] :: FirehoseLogDeliveryDescription -> Maybe Text

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   connector logic.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPlugin</a> smart constructor.

-- | Details about a connector's provisioned capacity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProvisionedCapacity</a> smart constructor.
data ProvisionedCapacity
ProvisionedCapacity' :: Natural -> Natural -> ProvisionedCapacity

-- | The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector
--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
[$sel:mcuCount:ProvisionedCapacity'] :: ProvisionedCapacity -> Natural

-- | The number of workers that are allocated to the connector.
[$sel:workerCount:ProvisionedCapacity'] :: ProvisionedCapacity -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ProvisionedCapacity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mcuCount:ProvisionedCapacity'</a>,
--   <a>provisionedCapacity_mcuCount</a> - The number of microcontroller
--   units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are
--   1,2,4,8.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workerCount:ProvisionedCapacity'</a>,
--   <a>provisionedCapacity_workerCount</a> - The number of workers that
--   are allocated to the connector.
newProvisionedCapacity :: Natural -> Natural -> ProvisionedCapacity

-- | The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector
--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
provisionedCapacity_mcuCount :: Lens' ProvisionedCapacity Natural

-- | The number of workers that are allocated to the connector.
provisionedCapacity_workerCount :: Lens' ProvisionedCapacity Natural

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProvisionedCapacityDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ProvisionedCapacityDescription

[$sel:workerCount:ProvisionedCapacityDescription'] :: ProvisionedCapacityDescription -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector
--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.

--   optional fields omitted.

--   microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The
--   valid values are 1,2,4,8.

provisionedCapacityDescription_workerCount :: Lens' ProvisionedCapacityDescription (Maybe Int)

--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
provisionedCapacityDescription_mcuCount :: Lens' ProvisionedCapacityDescription (Maybe Int)

-- | Details about delivering logs to Amazon S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3LogDelivery</a> smart constructor.
data S3LogDelivery

-- | The S3 prefix that is the destination for log delivery.
[$sel:prefix:S3LogDelivery'] :: S3LogDelivery -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the S3 bucket that is the destination for log delivery.
[$sel:bucket:S3LogDelivery'] :: S3LogDelivery -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether connector logs get sent to the specified Amazon S3
--   destination.
[$sel:enabled:S3LogDelivery'] :: S3LogDelivery -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>S3LogDelivery</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   S3 prefix that is the destination for log delivery.

--   name of the S3 bucket that is the destination for log delivery.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:S3LogDelivery'</a>, <a>s3LogDelivery_enabled</a> -
--   Specifies whether connector logs get sent to the specified Amazon S3
--   destination.
newS3LogDelivery :: Bool -> S3LogDelivery

-- | The name of the S3 bucket that is the destination for log delivery.
s3LogDelivery_bucket :: Lens' S3LogDelivery (Maybe Text)

--   destination.
s3LogDelivery_enabled :: Lens' S3LogDelivery Bool

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3LogDeliveryDescription</a> smart constructor.

-- | The scale-in policy for the connector.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScaleInPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data ScaleInPolicy

-- | Specifies the CPU utilization percentage threshold at which you want
--   connector scale in to be triggered.
[$sel:cpuUtilizationPercentage:ScaleInPolicy'] :: ScaleInPolicy -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ScaleInPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cpuUtilizationPercentage:ScaleInPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>scaleInPolicy_cpuUtilizationPercentage</a> - Specifies the CPU
--   utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector scale in
--   to be triggered.
newScaleInPolicy :: Natural -> ScaleInPolicy

-- | Specifies the CPU utilization percentage threshold at which you want
--   connector scale in to be triggered.
scaleInPolicy_cpuUtilizationPercentage :: Lens' ScaleInPolicy Natural

-- | The configuration of the workers, which are the processes that run the

--

-- | Workers can send worker logs to different destination types. This
--   configuration specifies the details of these destinations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkerLogDelivery</a> smart constructor.
data WorkerLogDelivery
WorkerLogDelivery' :: Maybe CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery -> Maybe FirehoseLogDelivery -> Maybe S3LogDelivery -> WorkerLogDelivery

-- | Details about delivering logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:cloudWatchLogs:WorkerLogDelivery'] :: WorkerLogDelivery -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery

-- | Details about delivering logs to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.
[$sel:firehose:WorkerLogDelivery'] :: WorkerLogDelivery -> Maybe FirehoseLogDelivery

-- | Details about delivering logs to Amazon S3.
[$sel:s3:WorkerLogDelivery'] :: WorkerLogDelivery -> Maybe S3LogDelivery

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkerLogDelivery</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:firehose:WorkerLogDelivery'</a>,

--   Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.

--   Details about delivering logs to Amazon S3.

workerLogDelivery_s3 :: Lens' WorkerLogDelivery (Maybe S3LogDelivery)

-- | Returns a list of all of the worker configurations in this account and
--   Region.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.ListWorkerConfigurations

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListWorkerConfigurations</a> smart constructor.
data ListWorkerConfigurations
ListWorkerConfigurations' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListWorkerConfigurations

-- | If the response of a ListWorkerConfigurations operation is truncated,
--   it will include a NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent
--   request to continue listing from where the previous operation left
--   off.
[$sel:nextToken:ListWorkerConfigurations'] :: ListWorkerConfigurations -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of worker configurations to list in one response.
[$sel:maxResults:ListWorkerConfigurations'] :: ListWorkerConfigurations -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListWorkerConfigurations</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListWorkerConfigurations'</a>,
--   <a>listWorkerConfigurations_nextToken</a> - If the response of a
--   ListWorkerConfigurations operation is truncated, it will include a
--   NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent request to continue
--   listing from where the previous operation left off.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListWorkerConfigurations'</a>,
--   <a>listWorkerConfigurations_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of
--   worker configurations to list in one response.
newListWorkerConfigurations :: ListWorkerConfigurations

-- | If the response of a ListWorkerConfigurations operation is truncated,
--   it will include a NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent
--   request to continue listing from where the previous operation left
--   off.
listWorkerConfigurations_nextToken :: Lens' ListWorkerConfigurations (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of worker configurations to list in one response.
listWorkerConfigurations_maxResults :: Lens' ListWorkerConfigurations (Maybe Natural)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListWorkerConfigurationsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ListWorkerConfigurationsResponse
ListWorkerConfigurationsResponse' :: Maybe [WorkerConfigurationSummary] -> Maybe Text -> Int -> ListWorkerConfigurationsResponse

-- | An array of worker configuration descriptions.
[$sel:workerConfigurations:ListWorkerConfigurationsResponse'] :: ListWorkerConfigurationsResponse -> Maybe [WorkerConfigurationSummary]

-- | If the response of a ListWorkerConfigurations operation is truncated,
--   it will include a NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent
--   request to continue listing from where the previous operation left
--   off.
[$sel:nextToken:ListWorkerConfigurationsResponse'] :: ListWorkerConfigurationsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListWorkerConfigurationsResponse'] :: ListWorkerConfigurationsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListWorkerConfigurationsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:workerConfigurations:ListWorkerConfigurationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listWorkerConfigurationsResponse_workerConfigurations</a> - An
--   array of worker configuration descriptions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListWorkerConfigurations'</a>,
--   <a>listWorkerConfigurationsResponse_nextToken</a> - If the response of
--   a ListWorkerConfigurations operation is truncated, it will include a
--   NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent request to continue
--   listing from where the previous operation left off.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListWorkerConfigurationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listWorkerConfigurationsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
newListWorkerConfigurationsResponse :: Int -> ListWorkerConfigurationsResponse

-- | If the response of a ListWorkerConfigurations operation is truncated,
--   it will include a NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent
--   request to continue listing from where the previous operation left
--   off.

-- | The response's http status code.
listWorkerConfigurationsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListWorkerConfigurationsResponse Int

-- | Returns a list of all of the custom plugins in this account and
--   Region.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.ListCustomPlugins

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListCustomPlugins</a> smart constructor.
data ListCustomPlugins
ListCustomPlugins' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListCustomPlugins

--   continue listing from where the previous operation left off.

-- | Returns a list of all the connectors in this account and Region. The
--   list is limited to connectors whose name starts with the specified
--   prefix. The response also includes a description of each of the listed
--   connectors.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.ListConnectors

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListConnectors</a> smart constructor.
data ListConnectors
ListConnectors' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListConnectors

-- | The name prefix that you want to use to search for and list
--   connectors.
[$sel:connectorNamePrefix:ListConnectors'] :: ListConnectors -> Maybe Text

-- | If the response of a ListConnectors operation is truncated, it will
--   include a NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent request to
--   continue listing from where the previous operation left off.
[$sel:nextToken:ListConnectors'] :: ListConnectors -> Maybe Text

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   want to use to search for and list connectors.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListConnectors'</a>, <a>listConnectors_nextToken</a>
--   - If the response of a ListConnectors operation is truncated, it will
--   include a NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent request to
--   continue listing from where the previous operation left off.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListConnectors'</a>,
--   <a>listConnectors_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of connectors to
--   list in one response.

-- | The name prefix that you want to use to search for and list
--   connectors.

-- | If the response of a ListConnectors operation is truncated, it will
--   include a NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent request to
--   continue listing from where the previous operation left off.
listConnectors_nextToken :: Lens' ListConnectors (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of connectors to list in one response.
listConnectors_maxResults :: Lens' ListConnectors (Maybe Natural)

--   want to get information about.

--   fields omitted.

--   constructor.

-- | The latest revision of the custom configuration.

[$sel:name:DescribeWorkerConfigurationResponse'] :: DescribeWorkerConfigurationResponse -> Maybe Text

[$sel:workerConfigurationArn:DescribeWorkerConfigurationResponse'] :: DescribeWorkerConfigurationResponse -> Maybe Text

[$sel:description:DescribeWorkerConfigurationResponse'] :: DescribeWorkerConfigurationResponse -> Maybe Text

[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeWorkerConfigurationResponse'] :: DescribeWorkerConfigurationResponse -> Int

--   optional fields omitted.

--   description of the worker configuration.

--   http status code.

--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--

--   about a custom plugin.

-- | Returns information about a custom plugin.
describeCustomPlugin_customPluginArn :: Lens' DescribeCustomPlugin Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeCustomPluginResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeCustomPluginResponse
DescribeCustomPluginResponse' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe CustomPluginRevisionSummary -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CustomPluginState -> Maybe Text -> Int -> DescribeCustomPluginResponse

-- | The time that the custom plugin was created.
[$sel:creationTime:DescribeCustomPluginResponse'] :: DescribeCustomPluginResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The latest successfully created revision of the custom plugin. If
--   there are no successfully created revisions, this field will be
--   absent.
[$sel:latestRevision:DescribeCustomPluginResponse'] :: DescribeCustomPluginResponse -> Maybe CustomPluginRevisionSummary

-- | The name of the custom plugin.
[$sel:name:DescribeCustomPluginResponse'] :: DescribeCustomPluginResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom plugin.
[$sel:customPluginArn:DescribeCustomPluginResponse'] :: DescribeCustomPluginResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The state of the custom plugin.
[$sel:customPluginState:DescribeCustomPluginResponse'] :: DescribeCustomPluginResponse -> Maybe CustomPluginState

-- | The description of the custom plugin.
[$sel:description:DescribeCustomPluginResponse'] :: DescribeCustomPluginResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeCustomPluginResponse'] :: DescribeCustomPluginResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeCustomPluginResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   custom plugin was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:latestRevision:DescribeCustomPluginResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeCustomPluginResponse_latestRevision</a> - The latest
--   successfully created revision of the custom plugin. If there are no
--   successfully created revisions, this field will be absent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:DescribeCustomPluginResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeCustomPluginResponse_name</a> - The name of the custom
--   plugin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customPluginArn:DescribeCustomPlugin'</a>,
--   <a>describeCustomPluginResponse_customPluginArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the custom plugin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customPluginState:DescribeCustomPluginResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeCustomPluginResponse_customPluginState</a> - The state of
--   the custom plugin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:DescribeCustomPluginResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeCustomPluginResponse_description</a> - The description of
--   the custom plugin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeCustomPluginResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeCustomPluginResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.

--   absent.

-- | Returns summary information about the connector.
module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.DescribeConnector

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeConnector</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeConnector
DescribeConnector' :: Text -> DescribeConnector

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connector that you want to
--   describe.
[$sel:connectorArn:DescribeConnector'] :: DescribeConnector -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeConnector</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorArn:DescribeConnector'</a>,
--   <a>describeConnector_connectorArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the connector that you want to describe.
newDescribeConnector :: Text -> DescribeConnector

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connector that you want to
--   describe.
describeConnector_connectorArn :: Lens' DescribeConnector Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeConnectorResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeConnectorResponse
DescribeConnectorResponse' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe KafkaClusterDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe LogDeliveryDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe WorkerConfigurationDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ConnectorState -> Maybe CapacityDescription -> Maybe [PluginDescription] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationDescription -> Maybe KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitDescription -> Maybe Text -> Int -> DescribeConnectorResponse

-- | The time the connector was created.
[$sel:creationTime:DescribeConnectorResponse'] :: DescribeConnectorResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Apache Kafka cluster that the connector is connected to.
[$sel:kafkaCluster:DescribeConnectorResponse'] :: DescribeConnectorResponse -> Maybe KafkaClusterDescription

-- | The version of Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the
--   Apache Kafka cluster's version and the plugins.
[$sel:kafkaConnectVersion:DescribeConnectorResponse'] :: DescribeConnectorResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Details about delivering logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:logDelivery:DescribeConnectorResponse'] :: DescribeConnectorResponse -> Maybe LogDeliveryDescription

-- | The current version of the connector.
[$sel:currentVersion:DescribeConnectorResponse'] :: DescribeConnectorResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A map of keys to values that represent the configuration for the
--   connector.
[$sel:connectorConfiguration:DescribeConnectorResponse'] :: DescribeConnectorResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Specifies which worker configuration was used for the connector.
[$sel:workerConfiguration:DescribeConnectorResponse'] :: DescribeConnectorResponse -> Maybe WorkerConfigurationDescription

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connector.
[$sel:connectorArn:DescribeConnectorResponse'] :: DescribeConnectorResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the connector.
[$sel:connectorName:DescribeConnectorResponse'] :: DescribeConnectorResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The state of the connector.
[$sel:connectorState:DescribeConnectorResponse'] :: DescribeConnectorResponse -> Maybe ConnectorState

-- | Information about the capacity of the connector, whether it is auto
--   scaled or provisioned.
[$sel:capacity:DescribeConnectorResponse'] :: DescribeConnectorResponse -> Maybe CapacityDescription

-- | Specifies which plugins were used for this connector.
[$sel:plugins:DescribeConnectorResponse'] :: DescribeConnectorResponse -> Maybe [PluginDescription]

-- | A summary description of the connector.
[$sel:connectorDescription:DescribeConnectorResponse'] :: DescribeConnectorResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka
--   cluster. The value is NONE when no client authentication is used.
[$sel:kafkaClusterClientAuthentication:DescribeConnectorResponse'] :: DescribeConnectorResponse -> Maybe KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationDescription

-- | Details of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.
[$sel:kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit:DescribeConnectorResponse'] :: DescribeConnectorResponse -> Maybe KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitDescription

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector
--   to access Amazon Web Services resources.
[$sel:serviceExecutionRoleArn:DescribeConnectorResponse'] :: DescribeConnectorResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeConnectorResponse'] :: DescribeConnectorResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeConnectorResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   was created.

--   <a>describeConnectorResponse_kafkaCluster</a> - The Apache Kafka
--   cluster that the connector is connected to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaConnectVersion:DescribeConnectorResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeConnectorResponse_kafkaConnectVersion</a> - The version of
--   Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the Apache Kafka
--   cluster's version and the plugins.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logDelivery:DescribeConnectorResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeConnectorResponse_logDelivery</a> - Details about
--   delivering logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

--   <a>describeConnectorResponse_currentVersion</a> - The current version
--   of the connector.

--   <a>describeConnectorResponse_connectorConfiguration</a> - A map of
--   keys to values that represent the configuration for the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workerConfiguration:DescribeConnectorResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeConnectorResponse_workerConfiguration</a> - Specifies which
--   worker configuration was used for the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorArn:DescribeConnector'</a>,
--   <a>describeConnectorResponse_connectorArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorName:DescribeConnectorResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeConnectorResponse_connectorName</a> - The name of the
--   connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorState:DescribeConnectorResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeConnectorResponse_connectorState</a> - The state of the
--   connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:capacity:DescribeConnectorResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeConnectorResponse_capacity</a> - Information about the
--   capacity of the connector, whether it is auto scaled or provisioned.

--   <a>$sel:plugins:DescribeConnectorResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeConnectorResponse_plugins</a> - Specifies which plugins
--   were used for this connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorDescription:DescribeConnectorResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeConnectorResponse_connectorDescription</a> - A summary
--   description of the connector.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaClusterClientAuthentication:DescribeConnectorResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeConnectorResponse_kafkaClusterClientAuthentication</a> -
--   The type of client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka
--   cluster. The value is NONE when no client authentication is used.

--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit:DescribeConnectorResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeConnectorResponse_kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit</a> -
--   Details of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceExecutionRoleArn:DescribeConnectorResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeConnectorResponse_serviceExecutionRoleArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector to access
--   Amazon Web Services resources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeConnectorResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeConnectorResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDescribeConnectorResponse :: Int -> DescribeConnectorResponse

describeConnectorResponse_creationTime :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Apache Kafka cluster that the connector is connected to.
describeConnectorResponse_kafkaCluster :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe KafkaClusterDescription)

-- | The version of Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the
--   Apache Kafka cluster's version and the plugins.
describeConnectorResponse_kafkaConnectVersion :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Details about delivering logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
describeConnectorResponse_logDelivery :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe LogDeliveryDescription)

-- | The current version of the connector.
describeConnectorResponse_currentVersion :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe Text)

--   connector.

--   to access Amazon Web Services resources.

describeConnectorResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse Int

-- | Deletes the specified connector.

--   delete.

-- | Creates a connector using the specified properties.
module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.CreateConnector

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateConnector</a> smart constructor.
data CreateConnector
CreateConnector' :: Maybe LogDelivery -> Maybe WorkerConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Capacity -> HashMap Text Text -> Text -> KafkaCluster -> KafkaClusterClientAuthentication -> KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit -> Text -> [Plugin] -> Text -> CreateConnector

-- | Details about log delivery.
[$sel:logDelivery:CreateConnector'] :: CreateConnector -> Maybe LogDelivery

-- | Specifies which worker configuration to use with the connector.
[$sel:workerConfiguration:CreateConnector'] :: CreateConnector -> Maybe WorkerConfiguration

-- | A summary description of the connector.
[$sel:connectorDescription:CreateConnector'] :: CreateConnector -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the capacity allocated to the connector. Exactly one
--   of the two properties must be specified.
[$sel:capacity:CreateConnector'] :: CreateConnector -> Capacity

-- | A map of keys to values that represent the configuration for the
--   connector.
[$sel:connectorConfiguration:CreateConnector'] :: CreateConnector -> HashMap Text Text

-- | The name of the connector.
[$sel:connectorName:CreateConnector'] :: CreateConnector -> Text

-- | Specifies which Apache Kafka cluster to connect to.
[$sel:kafkaCluster:CreateConnector'] :: CreateConnector -> KafkaCluster

-- | Details of the client authentication used by the Apache Kafka cluster.
[$sel:kafkaClusterClientAuthentication:CreateConnector'] :: CreateConnector -> KafkaClusterClientAuthentication

-- | Details of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.
[$sel:kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit:CreateConnector'] :: CreateConnector -> KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit

-- | The version of Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the
--   Apache Kafka cluster's version and the plugins.
[$sel:kafkaConnectVersion:CreateConnector'] :: CreateConnector -> Text

-- | Specifies which plugins to use for the connector.
[$sel:plugins:CreateConnector'] :: CreateConnector -> [Plugin]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector
--   to access the Amazon Web Services resources that it needs. The types
--   of resources depends on the logic of the connector. For example, a
--   connector that has Amazon S3 as a destination must have permissions
--   that allow it to write to the S3 destination bucket.
[$sel:serviceExecutionRoleArn:CreateConnector'] :: CreateConnector -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateConnector</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:logDelivery:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_logDelivery</a> - Details about log delivery.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workerConfiguration:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_workerConfiguration</a> - Specifies which worker
--   configuration to use with the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorDescription:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_connectorDescription</a> - A summary description of
--   the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:capacity:CreateConnector'</a>, <a>createConnector_capacity</a>
--   - Information about the capacity allocated to the connector. Exactly
--   one of the two properties must be specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorConfiguration:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_connectorConfiguration</a> - A map of keys to
--   values that represent the configuration for the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorName:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_connectorName</a> - The name of the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaCluster:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_kafkaCluster</a> - Specifies which Apache Kafka
--   cluster to connect to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaClusterClientAuthentication:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_kafkaClusterClientAuthentication</a> - Details of
--   the client authentication used by the Apache Kafka cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit</a> - Details of
--   encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaConnectVersion:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_kafkaConnectVersion</a> - The version of Kafka
--   Connect. It has to be compatible with both the Apache Kafka cluster's
--   version and the plugins.
--   
--   <a>$sel:plugins:CreateConnector'</a>, <a>createConnector_plugins</a> -
--   Specifies which plugins to use for the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceExecutionRoleArn:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_serviceExecutionRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector to access the Amazon
--   Web Services resources that it needs. The types of resources depends
--   on the logic of the connector. For example, a connector that has
--   Amazon S3 as a destination must have permissions that allow it to
--   write to the S3 destination bucket.
newCreateConnector :: Capacity -> Text -> KafkaCluster -> KafkaClusterClientAuthentication -> KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit -> Text -> Text -> CreateConnector

-- | Details about log delivery.
createConnector_logDelivery :: Lens' CreateConnector (Maybe LogDelivery)

-- | Specifies which worker configuration to use with the connector.
createConnector_workerConfiguration :: Lens' CreateConnector (Maybe WorkerConfiguration)

-- | A summary description of the connector.
createConnector_connectorDescription :: Lens' CreateConnector (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the capacity allocated to the connector. Exactly one
--   of the two properties must be specified.
createConnector_capacity :: Lens' CreateConnector Capacity

-- | A map of keys to values that represent the configuration for the
--   connector.
createConnector_connectorConfiguration :: Lens' CreateConnector (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The name of the connector.
createConnector_connectorName :: Lens' CreateConnector Text

-- | Specifies which Apache Kafka cluster to connect to.
createConnector_kafkaCluster :: Lens' CreateConnector KafkaCluster

-- | Details of the client authentication used by the Apache Kafka cluster.
createConnector_kafkaClusterClientAuthentication :: Lens' CreateConnector KafkaClusterClientAuthentication

-- | Details of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.
createConnector_kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit :: Lens' CreateConnector KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit

-- | The version of Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the
--   Apache Kafka cluster's version and the plugins.
createConnector_kafkaConnectVersion :: Lens' CreateConnector Text

-- | Specifies which plugins to use for the connector.
createConnector_plugins :: Lens' CreateConnector [Plugin]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector
--   to access the Amazon Web Services resources that it needs. The types
--   of resources depends on the logic of the connector. For example, a
--   connector that has Amazon S3 as a destination must have permissions
--   that allow it to write to the S3 destination bucket.
createConnector_serviceExecutionRoleArn :: Lens' CreateConnector Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateConnectorResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateConnectorResponse
CreateConnectorResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ConnectorState -> Int -> CreateConnectorResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that Amazon assigned to the connector.
[$sel:connectorArn:CreateConnectorResponse'] :: CreateConnectorResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the connector.
[$sel:connectorName:CreateConnectorResponse'] :: CreateConnectorResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The state of the connector.
[$sel:connectorState:CreateConnectorResponse'] :: CreateConnectorResponse -> Maybe ConnectorState

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateConnectorResponse'] :: CreateConnectorResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateConnectorResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   (ARN) that Amazon assigned to the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorName:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnectorResponse_connectorName</a> - The name of the
--   connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorState:CreateConnectorResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createConnectorResponse_connectorState</a> - The state of the
--   connector.
--

--   <a>createConnectorResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.

createConnectorResponse_connectorArn :: Lens' CreateConnectorResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The state of the connector.
createConnectorResponse_connectorState :: Lens' CreateConnectorResponse (Maybe ConnectorState)

createConnectorResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateConnectorResponse Int

-- | Updates the specified connector.
module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.UpdateConnector

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateConnector</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateConnector
UpdateConnector' :: CapacityUpdate -> Text -> Text -> UpdateConnector

-- | The target capacity.
[$sel:capacity:UpdateConnector'] :: UpdateConnector -> CapacityUpdate

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connector that you want to
--   update.
[$sel:connectorArn:UpdateConnector'] :: UpdateConnector -> Text

-- | The current version of the connector that you want to update.
[$sel:currentVersion:UpdateConnector'] :: UpdateConnector -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateConnector</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:capacity:UpdateConnector'</a>, <a>updateConnector_capacity</a>
--   - The target capacity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorArn:UpdateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>updateConnector_connectorArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the connector that you want to update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentVersion:UpdateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>updateConnector_currentVersion</a> - The current version of the
--   connector that you want to update.
newUpdateConnector :: CapacityUpdate -> Text -> Text -> UpdateConnector

-- | The target capacity.
updateConnector_capacity :: Lens' UpdateConnector CapacityUpdate

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connector that you want to
--   update.
updateConnector_connectorArn :: Lens' UpdateConnector Text

-- | The current version of the connector that you want to update.
updateConnector_currentVersion :: Lens' UpdateConnector Text

-- | The state of the connector.

[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateConnectorResponse'] :: UpdateConnectorResponse -> Int

--   fields omitted.

module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Lens

-- | If the response of a ListWorkerConfigurations operation is truncated,
--   it will include a NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent
--   request to continue listing from where the previous operation left
--   off.
listWorkerConfigurations_nextToken :: Lens' ListWorkerConfigurations (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of worker configurations to list in one response.
listWorkerConfigurations_maxResults :: Lens' ListWorkerConfigurations (Maybe Natural)

-- | An array of worker configuration descriptions.
listWorkerConfigurationsResponse_workerConfigurations :: Lens' ListWorkerConfigurationsResponse (Maybe [WorkerConfigurationSummary])

-- | If the response of a ListWorkerConfigurations operation is truncated,
--   it will include a NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent
--   request to continue listing from where the previous operation left
--   off.
listWorkerConfigurationsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListWorkerConfigurationsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listWorkerConfigurationsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListWorkerConfigurationsResponse Int

-- | Returns information about a custom plugin.
describeCustomPlugin_customPluginArn :: Lens' DescribeCustomPlugin Text

-- | The time that the custom plugin was created.
describeCustomPluginResponse_creationTime :: Lens' DescribeCustomPluginResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The latest successfully created revision of the custom plugin. If
--   there are no successfully created revisions, this field will be
--   absent.
describeCustomPluginResponse_latestRevision :: Lens' DescribeCustomPluginResponse (Maybe CustomPluginRevisionSummary)

-- | The name of the custom plugin.
describeCustomPluginResponse_name :: Lens' DescribeCustomPluginResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom plugin.

-- | The state of the custom plugin.

-- | The response's http status code.
describeCustomPluginResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeCustomPluginResponse Int

deleteConnector_currentVersion :: Lens' DeleteConnector (Maybe Text)

--   delete.
deleteConnector_connectorArn :: Lens' DeleteConnector Text

--   delete.

--   connectors.

--   include a NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent request to

--   continue listing from where it left off.

--   describe.

describeConnectorResponse_creationTime :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

describeConnectorResponse_kafkaCluster :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe KafkaClusterDescription)

-- | The version of Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the
--   Apache Kafka cluster's version and the plugins.
describeConnectorResponse_kafkaConnectVersion :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Details about delivering logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
describeConnectorResponse_logDelivery :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe LogDeliveryDescription)

-- | The current version of the connector.
describeConnectorResponse_currentVersion :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A map of keys to values that represent the configuration for the
--   connector.
describeConnectorResponse_connectorConfiguration :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Specifies which worker configuration was used for the connector.
describeConnectorResponse_workerConfiguration :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe WorkerConfigurationDescription)

describeConnectorResponse_connectorArn :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the connector.
describeConnectorResponse_connectorName :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The state of the connector.
describeConnectorResponse_connectorState :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe ConnectorState)

-- | Information about the capacity of the connector, whether it is auto
--   scaled or provisioned.
describeConnectorResponse_capacity :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe CapacityDescription)

-- | Specifies which plugins were used for this connector.
describeConnectorResponse_plugins :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe [PluginDescription])

-- | A summary description of the connector.
describeConnectorResponse_connectorDescription :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka
--   cluster. The value is NONE when no client authentication is used.
describeConnectorResponse_kafkaClusterClientAuthentication :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationDescription)

-- | Details of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.
describeConnectorResponse_kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitDescription)

--   to access Amazon Web Services resources.
describeConnectorResponse_serviceExecutionRoleArn :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeConnectorResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeConnectorResponse Int

createCustomPlugin_contentType :: Lens' CreateCustomPlugin CustomPluginContentType

-- | Information about the location of a custom plugin.
createCustomPlugin_location :: Lens' CreateCustomPlugin CustomPluginLocation

-- | The name of the custom plugin.
createCustomPlugin_name :: Lens' CreateCustomPlugin Text

--   plugin.
createCustomPluginResponse_customPluginArn :: Lens' CreateCustomPluginResponse (Maybe Text)

createCustomPluginResponse_customPluginState :: Lens' CreateCustomPluginResponse (Maybe CustomPluginState)

-- | The revision of the custom plugin.
createCustomPluginResponse_revision :: Lens' CreateCustomPluginResponse (Maybe Integer)

-- | The response's http status code.
createCustomPluginResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateCustomPluginResponse Int

-- | The bootstrap servers of the cluster.
apacheKafkaCluster_bootstrapServers :: Lens' ApacheKafkaCluster Text

-- | Details of an Amazon VPC which has network connectivity to the Apache
--   Kafka cluster.
apacheKafkaCluster_vpc :: Lens' ApacheKafkaCluster Vpc

-- | The bootstrap servers of the cluster.
apacheKafkaClusterDescription_bootstrapServers :: Lens' ApacheKafkaClusterDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Details of an Amazon VPC which has network connectivity to the Apache
--   Kafka cluster.
apacheKafkaClusterDescription_vpc :: Lens' ApacheKafkaClusterDescription (Maybe VpcDescription)

-- | The sacle-in policy for the connector.
autoScaling_scaleInPolicy :: Lens' AutoScaling (Maybe ScaleInPolicy)

-- | The sacle-out policy for the connector.
autoScaling_scaleOutPolicy :: Lens' AutoScaling (Maybe ScaleOutPolicy)

-- | The maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
autoScaling_maxWorkerCount :: Lens' AutoScaling Natural

-- | The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector
--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
autoScaling_mcuCount :: Lens' AutoScaling Natural

-- | The minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
autoScaling_minWorkerCount :: Lens' AutoScaling Natural

-- | The sacle-in policy for the connector.
autoScalingDescription_scaleInPolicy :: Lens' AutoScalingDescription (Maybe ScaleInPolicyDescription)

-- | The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector
--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
autoScalingDescription_mcuCount :: Lens' AutoScalingDescription (Maybe Int)

-- | The sacle-out policy for the connector.&gt;
autoScalingDescription_scaleOutPolicy :: Lens' AutoScalingDescription (Maybe ScaleOutPolicyDescription)

-- | The maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
autoScalingDescription_maxWorkerCount :: Lens' AutoScalingDescription (Maybe Int)

-- | The minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
autoScalingDescription_minWorkerCount :: Lens' AutoScalingDescription (Maybe Int)

-- | The target maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
autoScalingUpdate_maxWorkerCount :: Lens' AutoScalingUpdate Natural

--   connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
autoScalingUpdate_mcuCount :: Lens' AutoScalingUpdate Natural

-- | The target minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
autoScalingUpdate_minWorkerCount :: Lens' AutoScalingUpdate Natural

autoScalingUpdate_scaleInPolicy :: Lens' AutoScalingUpdate ScaleInPolicyUpdate

-- | The target sacle-out policy for the connector.
autoScalingUpdate_scaleOutPolicy :: Lens' AutoScalingUpdate ScaleOutPolicyUpdate

capacity_provisionedCapacity :: Lens' Capacity (Maybe ProvisionedCapacity)

capacityDescription_autoScaling :: Lens' CapacityDescription (Maybe AutoScalingDescription)

capacityUpdate_autoScaling :: Lens' CapacityUpdate (Maybe AutoScalingUpdate)

-- | The target settings for provisioned capacity.
capacityUpdate_provisionedCapacity :: Lens' CapacityUpdate (Maybe ProvisionedCapacityUpdate)

--   connected.

module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2021-09-14</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
module Network.AWS.KafkaConnect

-- | API version <tt>2021-09-14</tt> of the Amazon Managed Streaming for
--   Kafka Connect SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | HTTP Status Code 409: Conflict. A resource with this name already
--   exists. Retry your request with another name.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | HTTP Status Code 403: Access forbidden. Correct your credentials and
--   then retry your request.
_ForbiddenException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | HTTP Status Code 404: Resource not found due to incorrect input.
--   Correct your request and then retry it.
_NotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | HTTP Status Code 429: Limit exceeded. Resource limit reached.
_TooManyRequestsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | HTTP Status Code 500: Unexpected internal server error. Retrying your
--   request might resolve the issue.
_InternalServerErrorException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | HTTP Status Code 503: Service Unavailable. Retrying your request in
--   some time might resolve the issue.
_ServiceUnavailableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | HTTP Status Code 401: Unauthorized request. The provided credentials
--   couldn't be validated.
_UnauthorizedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | HTTP Status Code 400: Bad request due to incorrect input. Correct your
--   request and then retry it.
_BadRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

data UpdateConnectorResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateConnectorResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorArn:UpdateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>updateConnectorResponse_connectorArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorState:UpdateConnectorResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateConnectorResponse_connectorState</a> - The state of the
--   connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateConnectorResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateConnectorResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newUpdateConnectorResponse :: Int -> UpdateConnectorResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateConnector</a> smart constructor.
data CreateConnector
CreateConnector' :: Maybe LogDelivery -> Maybe WorkerConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Capacity -> HashMap Text Text -> Text -> KafkaCluster -> KafkaClusterClientAuthentication -> KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit -> Text -> [Plugin] -> Text -> CreateConnector

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateConnector</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:logDelivery:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_logDelivery</a> - Details about log delivery.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workerConfiguration:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_workerConfiguration</a> - Specifies which worker
--   configuration to use with the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorDescription:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_connectorDescription</a> - A summary description of
--   the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:capacity:CreateConnector'</a>, <a>createConnector_capacity</a>
--   - Information about the capacity allocated to the connector. Exactly
--   one of the two properties must be specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorConfiguration:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_connectorConfiguration</a> - A map of keys to
--   values that represent the configuration for the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorName:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_connectorName</a> - The name of the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaCluster:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_kafkaCluster</a> - Specifies which Apache Kafka
--   cluster to connect to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaClusterClientAuthentication:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_kafkaClusterClientAuthentication</a> - Details of
--   the client authentication used by the Apache Kafka cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit</a> - Details of
--   encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaConnectVersion:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_kafkaConnectVersion</a> - The version of Kafka
--   Connect. It has to be compatible with both the Apache Kafka cluster's
--   version and the plugins.
--   
--   <a>$sel:plugins:CreateConnector'</a>, <a>createConnector_plugins</a> -
--   Specifies which plugins to use for the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceExecutionRoleArn:CreateConnector'</a>,
--   <a>createConnector_serviceExecutionRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector to access the Amazon
--   Web Services resources that it needs. The types of resources depends
--   on the logic of the connector. For example, a connector that has
--   Amazon S3 as a destination must have permissions that allow it to
--   write to the S3 destination bucket.
newCreateConnector :: Capacity -> Text -> KafkaCluster -> KafkaClusterClientAuthentication -> KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit -> Text -> Text -> CreateConnector

newtype ConnectorState
ConnectorState' :: Text -> ConnectorState
[fromConnectorState] :: ConnectorState -> Text
pattern ConnectorState_CREATING :: ConnectorState
pattern ConnectorState_DELETING :: ConnectorState
pattern ConnectorState_FAILED :: ConnectorState
pattern ConnectorState_RUNNING :: ConnectorState
pattern ConnectorState_UPDATING :: ConnectorState
newtype CustomPluginContentType
CustomPluginContentType' :: Text -> CustomPluginContentType
[fromCustomPluginContentType] :: CustomPluginContentType -> Text
pattern CustomPluginContentType_JAR :: CustomPluginContentType
pattern CustomPluginContentType_ZIP :: CustomPluginContentType
newtype CustomPluginState
CustomPluginState' :: Text -> CustomPluginState
[fromCustomPluginState] :: CustomPluginState -> Text
pattern CustomPluginState_ACTIVE :: CustomPluginState
pattern CustomPluginState_CREATE_FAILED :: CustomPluginState
pattern CustomPluginState_CREATING :: CustomPluginState
pattern CustomPluginState_DELETING :: CustomPluginState
pattern CustomPluginState_UPDATE_FAILED :: CustomPluginState
pattern CustomPluginState_UPDATING :: CustomPluginState
newtype KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType
KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType' :: Text -> KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType
[fromKafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType] :: KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType -> Text
pattern KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType_IAM :: KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType
pattern KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType_NONE :: KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationType
newtype KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitType
KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitType' :: Text -> KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitType
[fromKafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitType] :: KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitType -> Text
pattern KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitType_PLAINTEXT :: KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitType
pattern KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitType_TLS :: KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitType

--   <a>$sel:vpc:ApacheKafkaCluster'</a>, <a>apacheKafkaCluster_vpc</a> -
--   Details of an Amazon VPC which has network connectivity to the Apache
--   Kafka cluster.

-- | Specifies how the connector scales.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScaling</a> smart constructor.
data AutoScaling
AutoScaling' :: Maybe ScaleInPolicy -> Maybe ScaleOutPolicy -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> AutoScaling

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScaling</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleInPolicy:AutoScaling'</a>,
--   <a>autoScaling_scaleInPolicy</a> - The sacle-in policy for the
--   connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleOutPolicy:AutoScaling'</a>,
--   <a>autoScaling_scaleOutPolicy</a> - The sacle-out policy for the
--   connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxWorkerCount:AutoScaling'</a>,
--   <a>autoScaling_maxWorkerCount</a> - The maximum number of workers
--   allocated to the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mcuCount:AutoScaling'</a>, <a>autoScaling_mcuCount</a> - The
--   number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector
--   worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minWorkerCount:AutoScaling'</a>,
--   <a>autoScaling_minWorkerCount</a> - The minimum number of workers
--   allocated to the connector.
newAutoScaling :: Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> AutoScaling

-- | Information about the auto scaling parameters for the connector.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScalingDescription</a> smart constructor.
data AutoScalingDescription
AutoScalingDescription' :: Maybe ScaleInPolicyDescription -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ScaleOutPolicyDescription -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> AutoScalingDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScalingDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleInPolicy:AutoScalingDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingDescription_scaleInPolicy</a> - The sacle-in policy for
--   the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mcuCount:AutoScalingDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingDescription_mcuCount</a> - The number of microcontroller
--   units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are
--   1,2,4,8.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleOutPolicy:AutoScalingDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingDescription_scaleOutPolicy</a> - The sacle-out policy
--   for the connector.&gt;
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxWorkerCount:AutoScalingDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingDescription_maxWorkerCount</a> - The maximum number of
--   workers allocated to the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minWorkerCount:AutoScalingDescription'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingDescription_minWorkerCount</a> - The minimum number of
--   workers allocated to the connector.
newAutoScalingDescription :: AutoScalingDescription

-- | The updates to the auto scaling parameters for the connector.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScalingUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data AutoScalingUpdate
AutoScalingUpdate' :: Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> ScaleInPolicyUpdate -> ScaleOutPolicyUpdate -> AutoScalingUpdate

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScalingUpdate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxWorkerCount:AutoScalingUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingUpdate_maxWorkerCount</a> - The target maximum number of
--   workers allocated to the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mcuCount:AutoScalingUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingUpdate_mcuCount</a> - The target number of
--   microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The
--   valid values are 1,2,4,8.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minWorkerCount:AutoScalingUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingUpdate_minWorkerCount</a> - The target minimum number of
--   workers allocated to the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleInPolicy:AutoScalingUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingUpdate_scaleInPolicy</a> - The target sacle-in policy
--   for the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scaleOutPolicy:AutoScalingUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingUpdate_scaleOutPolicy</a> - The target sacle-out policy
--   for the connector.
newAutoScalingUpdate :: Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> ScaleInPolicyUpdate -> ScaleOutPolicyUpdate -> AutoScalingUpdate

-- | Information about the capacity of the connector, whether it is auto
--   scaled or provisioned.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCapacity</a> smart constructor.
data Capacity
Capacity' :: Maybe AutoScaling -> Maybe ProvisionedCapacity -> Capacity

-- | Create a value of <a>Capacity</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScaling:Capacity'</a>, <a>capacity_autoScaling</a> -
--   Information about the auto scaling parameters for the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedCapacity:Capacity'</a>,
--   <a>capacity_provisionedCapacity</a> - Details about a fixed capacity
--   allocated to a connector.
newCapacity :: Capacity

-- | A description of the connector's capacity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCapacityDescription</a> smart constructor.
data CapacityDescription
CapacityDescription' :: Maybe AutoScalingDescription -> Maybe ProvisionedCapacityDescription -> CapacityDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>CapacityDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScaling:CapacityDescription'</a>,
--   <a>capacityDescription_autoScaling</a> - Describes the connector's
--   auto scaling capacity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedCapacity:CapacityDescription'</a>,
--   <a>capacityDescription_provisionedCapacity</a> - Describes a
--   connector's provisioned capacity.
newCapacityDescription :: CapacityDescription

-- | The target capacity for the connector. The capacity can be auto scaled
--   or provisioned.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCapacityUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data CapacityUpdate

--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScaling:CapacityUpdate'</a>,

--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedCapacity:CapacityUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>capacityUpdate_provisionedCapacity</a> - The target settings for
--   provisioned capacity.
newCapacityUpdate :: CapacityUpdate

-- | Summary of a connector.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newConnectorSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ConnectorSummary
ConnectorSummary' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe KafkaClusterDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe LogDeliveryDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe WorkerConfigurationDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ConnectorState -> Maybe CapacityDescription -> Maybe [PluginDescription] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationDescription -> Maybe KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitDescription -> Maybe Text -> ConnectorSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>ConnectorSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_creationTime</a> - The time that the connector was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaCluster:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_kafkaCluster</a> - The details of the Apache Kafka
--   cluster to which the connector is connected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaConnectVersion:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_kafkaConnectVersion</a> - The version of Kafka
--   Connect. It has to be compatible with both the Apache Kafka cluster's
--   version and the plugins.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logDelivery:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_logDelivery</a> - The settings for delivering
--   connector logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentVersion:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_currentVersion</a> - The current version of the
--   connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workerConfiguration:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_workerConfiguration</a> - The worker
--   configurations that are in use with the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorArn:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_connectorArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorName:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_connectorName</a> - The name of the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorState:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_connectorState</a> - The state of the connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:capacity:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_capacity</a> - The connector's compute capacity
--   settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:plugins:ConnectorSummary'</a>, <a>connectorSummary_plugins</a>
--   - Specifies which plugins were used for this connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectorDescription:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_connectorDescription</a> - The description of the
--   connector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaClusterClientAuthentication:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_kafkaClusterClientAuthentication</a> - The type of
--   client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka cluster. The
--   value is NONE when no client authentication is used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit</a> - Details of
--   encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceExecutionRoleArn:ConnectorSummary'</a>,
--   <a>connectorSummary_serviceExecutionRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector to access Amazon Web
--   Services resources.
newConnectorSummary :: ConnectorSummary

-- | The description of the encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka
--   cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitDescription</a> smart

-- | Workers can send worker logs to different destination types. This
--   configuration specifies the details of these destinations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkerLogDelivery</a> smart constructor.
data WorkerLogDelivery
WorkerLogDelivery' :: Maybe CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery -> Maybe FirehoseLogDelivery -> Maybe S3LogDelivery -> WorkerLogDelivery

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkerLogDelivery</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:firehose:WorkerLogDelivery'</a>,
--   <a>workerLogDelivery_firehose</a> - Details about delivering logs to
--   Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3:WorkerLogDelivery'</a>, <a>workerLogDelivery_s3</a> -
--   Details about delivering logs to Amazon S3.
newWorkerLogDelivery :: WorkerLogDelivery

-- | Workers can send worker logs to different destination types. This
--   configuration specifies the details of these destinations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkerLogDeliveryDescription</a> smart constructor.
data WorkerLogDeliveryDescription

--   optional fields omitted.
